1m9vKazD6LmYHWWrLZQImQ.text: This is a very hard review for me, but hopefully ... My explanation will help you understand the low rating. I ordered the blackened salmon with two sides of the smashed potatoes and the cucumber salad. Everything was very tasty. But the piece of salmon that I received was seriously 1 inch wide by 6 inches long. For $10! Now I'm not sure why, but every time I go, it seems like the salmon serving gets smaller and smaller. Not sure if it's because it's lunch? But I'm a big girl and I like a normal piece of fish. 3-4 inches wide by 6 inches long. Very odd experience for me. I wish I had taken a photo, but it was just so surprised that I just dug in and ate what was there.

8z6vl34sLQ1iP4zPgF8XIQ.text: Food is always good! Small place so allow yourself enough time to enjoy your meal. They close at 10 and are usually busy. You will be waiting for an average of about 20mins to be seated. Don't keep this friendly staff at work longer than they have to be.

r2Uuh6sAm3HIazmrKnL-jw.text: I've been to Cajun Yard Dog a few times before however this is the first time I actually remembered to take a picture and leave a review haha. So this time around I got blackened meatloaf with tomato gravy and two sides, sweet potato fries and mac and cheese. The meatloaf was amazing and the tomato gravy made it 100 times better, the sweet potato fries are the bomb and the Mac and cheese was pretty good, the flavors are all there it was just a little salty for me. I don't remember what I had last time but I live near ballantyne so this place is a good drive, but it is definitely worth it. Mostly for the prices they have it's probably the best for cajun food. However if you're looking for a little upscale, it's a bit pricy compared to Cajun Yard Dog but, you should try Cajun Queen.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Meatloaf with tomato gravy, sweet potato fries and mac and cheese

2hN1mkp9HaayLVZBUpRqHw.text: The key to this place is ordering right! Highly recommend their fried chicken or chicken jambalaya. Friendly staff and owner keep us coming back. This is a must to try if you are in the south Charlotte area.   But keep in mind seating inside and the outside waiting area is limited and its first come first serve.

4PghHBZG6wPLwP_SfyvJjw.text: Amazing! Tops the two day trip to New Orleans. Catch of the day was swordfish, my wife had that and Tabasco marinated catfish fritters, I had the chicken and seafood jambalaya. Sides were mac and cheese.  Price was perfect and for the first time I didn't need to season my food no salt or sauces like I normally do.  Owner was working lunch and I always respect a restaurant that the owner takes pride and works to keep quality and service up.  Live in Boone NC but will be back!

MIc--7mcSVcQXT67pynnwA.text: Had a great pre Thanksgiving dinner here.  The service was personable and the ambiance was welcoming.  Had the fried green tomatoes for an appetizer, and all the enteees were great. I had the excellent chicken jambalaya, and my kids had the crab cakes and Cajun chicken.  Both were fantastic , especially the crab cakes - and we are from Maryland so praising NC crab cakes is saying something!  Can't wait to come back, but I highly recommend for anyone in the area!!  Great for a pre- or post -movie night bite to eat!

-UveAQAFWBPasXgjUNchcg.text: I LOVE Cajun Yard Dog. Every time I come here, the food is amazing and the service is excellent. Such a cute place to go with friends or family. I love their jalapeno deviled eggs and their bread pudding. OMG best bread pudding ever. I usually get the tabasco strips with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. I never regret it. Some of the tastiest food in Charlotte, in my opinion.

aUYQv8gL1oyj7RP-XMK-VQ.text: Love the oyster po-boy and the fried green tomato po-boy! The smothered cabbage is amazing. Great seasonal beers and Abita Turbodog always on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; seafood jambalaya

QERZOi8S7W-fE9_6inykmw.text: Blech!!!! Cajun, seafood blech! The fish was so cooked that it fell apart with all the bones. Couldn't even get a bite w/o the bones.

HpqaGoLFaio3PZobs_dhew.text: Food was ok.  Very small place, but everyone was nice.  I got the fried shrimp which lacked any seasoning but was perfectly cooked. I also had blackened trout, again lacked seasoning big was perfectly cooked.  My husband had the fried chicken, perfectly cooked lacked seasoning.  All in all not impressed but I did get a descent meal.

Kcrba9zAiXvSB1OnRuCUhQ.text: It's not 100% authentic Cajun but it fulfilled the craving of a La/TX transplant. The fried chicken was incredible and fried to order. Shrimp and grits were very tasty. The only disappointment was the gumbo - good flavor, poor consistency. I will visit again soon.

bBKFrnk8Hq4j-pj0zPORTQ.text: Wow! Wow! Wow! So Amazing! Best Fried Chicken Ever! Best Service Ever! We love the food and the staff are always so friendly,respectful and helpful!  A++++!!! Yum!

vLP18yDB_55NszxovWzTbQ.text: This was my first time here. Friends have highly recommended it and others advised me to pass. I decided on carry-out.   I had the chicken cordon bleu (blue?), potato salad and mac n cheese. I also ordered some jambalaya. The chicken itself was very good. It was crispy, moist and nicely seasoned. Essentially a great fried chicken breast with a slice of ham on top followed by cheese and maque choux. Chicken, slice of ham, corn, cheese and spices. Although good, not exceptional. The mac n cheese was good. The potato salad was average. The jambalaya was good, but not exceptional for a Cajun restaurant. Maybe I was expecting more? I would go back, but not necessarily out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Cordon Bleu (blue)

HgdlvHKStMAGM3jSh9Ul4g.text: Food was delicious! I got the chicken and rice jambalaya and macaroni and cheese. Macaroni and cheese was so delicious I got a second order. Will definitely be back!

b-YtET0e9Bw2_f_FE7CGww.text: Excellent service.  They gave a sample of the mac n cheese to our daughter to see if she'd like it; we all did.  The nightly special Two Step Bayou over dirty rice was awesome.  We highly recommend Cajun Yard Dog

e-0iRztcRfmioiejuusadg.text: Great food, no matter whatcha get. (Try the smothered cabbage if you haven't yet!!) The staff is always friendly and attentive. Get there early cause it gets packed!

GCvJmdg9ACMdWk8u2wfGGw.text: Very good food, good wait service, but we got a horrible table that completely killed the experience. We watched the host and owner debate how best to divvy up 3 tables for a 6 top and 2 top. Ultimately, we as the 2 top got the shaft and were placed right next to the door and those waiting for a table. They were less than a foot away, and the host and owner manager kept walking up to our table, and talking to the people behind us. Terrible experience, although if we were at any other table, we would have had a great time. That one table sabotaged the entire experience for us and I can't see going back.

abJBrNWZ8pgb5ULpxIlJAg.text: We had the BBQ Shrimp for an appetizer. They were very good and flavorful. The grits were 2 thumbs up. The tobasco strips were homemade and had a great flavor. The Mac and cheese was exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

2a1rSH7AzGPIIsFaDLe1Fw.text: Great food and atmosphere  Jalapeno deviled eggs were an amazing appetizer. We had the shrimp and grits, andoille pasta, and the crab cakes. All were extremely flavorful. We ended with the bananas foster dessert witch was amazing and was devoured  in a manner of a shark feeding frenzy

_dzgRaoVCTfIdYg_EDSslw.text: We have been going to the Dog since we found it tucked away in Arboretum a few years ago.  Everything is consistently fresh and extremely tasty.  We go for lunch at least once a month on Saturdays and my wife always gets whatever the fresh catch of the day is and it is always wonderful and she can be picky!  We have tried almost everything and it is always great.  Last year, I had all my buddies from the office there to rave reviews.  If you like a bit of spice, ask for the dog sauces...the one with the ghost pepper is fantastic; flavor with good kick.  One thing though...bring back the pulled pork sandwich!!!  That was the bomb!

S6Au48w2jng71oPWReF8MA.text: Omg. Soooooo good. A lot of fried /fatty food so if you eat healthy this is a good "cheat day" spot. I never had fried catfish and it was so good I am open to try it again. Their specialty yard dog sauce was sweet and spicy- definitely one of a kind. Collard greens didn't have much flavor but I was okay with that as everything else I got was so flavorful . My boyfriend got steak with bbq shrimp and the shrimp was good (I don't eat red meat) as well as the steak per his words. He was in love with the sweet potato fries and homemade honey mustard , I swear he inhaled them. I will say for the price it isn't a lot of portion. No left overs as everything seemed to come measured in 1 cup servings. Other than the price vs. quantity of food everything was great!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Back menu
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front menu

Jb34qW9-dZEmYMwGWUUTLA.text: Couldn't find anything wrong with the Cajun Yard Dog when I was there. Food was excellent and the service was just as good. Everybody who works there is very friendly and makes you feel as though you've known them forever. I definitely recommend the fried chicken!

9NRY9tlBbyZj1RufauV3eQ.text: Fantastic fried mushrooms and the Red Beans and rice was great. Good quick service, cannot wait to come back. Large portions.....

xPuOm0qLc_CYy4fr_tcSlQ.text: Definitely not my fave. Ordered take-out and the guy taking the phone order was pretty rude and snippy! We ordered the crab cakes, Mac and cheese and jumbo shrimp. The crab cakes were fried very hard and it felt as if I were chewing pieces of eggshells. The Mac and cheese was ok and my husband said his shrimp was just ok. This was my second visit to this location but I'm not a True fan of their food.

giMKtPUkXXvHMl_9mxauTg.text: The fried oyster is my go to when I stop by. Heck, it's the only reason I drive over to the area. I've ordered the dish since 2012 or so. Recently, it seems like they've changed the recipe for it. They used to be full sized oysters that was coated nicely in batter. Now, it's bite sized pieces and when I ordered my take out, it was overcooked. If I had the time, I would've requested them to remake it but today, I had to eat what was given.   They have other food items which aren't that bad. It's the only nearby creole that I know of. The decor has that Mardi Gras feeling. Very causal but it's a small seating area. If you plan on a large group, it's best to call in before stepping in.   Sometimes it's busy but at times when it's not, you would expect the servers to check on you every so to make sure you're good on the beverages.   It's a nice little restaurant and if you're in the mood for the type of food and are nearby, then definitely stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Oysters, green beans and mixed veggies (to-go order)

GIfOfTQpH_8j4SIZtAtOZQ.text: Bon temps.  Very good substitute for being in New Orleans.  Debbie was a doll and took good care of us.  Save room for bananas foster and bread pudding.  Hello food coma.

mbBOwSOiWZwfP_fVdgb_VQ.text: This place is awesome we had the chicken jambalaya perfect, gumbo perfect,fried oysters,Mac and cheese also yummy and the deserts were bread pudding and bananas foster super delicious our server Jennifer was funny and great. We definitely will be back

yu4iqwOQ9mjPddGYPfjcyQ.text: A very solid 4/5 stars. With any restaurant I always ask myself Would I go back? Sure.   Good food Delicious food.

SPZJmU1tedYeicl3z6tbFQ.text: I absolutely LOVE Cajun Yard Dog! My first time going was a few years ago when I use to live in Charlotte. My boss took me and we liked it so much, we went back with our entire team. So since I was recently in town for CIAA, I met with a former employee there. The food was great - we had the jalapeno devil eggs as an appetizer (perfection), both of us has the crab cakes (delicious - seasoned to perfection...I wish it was bigger tho), and I had a side salad and sweet potato fries. My friend had mac & cheese & cucumber salad. The mac & cheese was so good, we ordered an additional side of it & shared it. The service was okay, but in the waiters defense it was his second or third day. But I have confidence he'll be great going forward. He was kinda cute too . Another great experience and the food was great too. I will definitely be returning again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeño Devil Eggs
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cake &amp; Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side Salad

GsgmvJ7JQ-4EbnfY4Pe37A.text: Tonight we stopped by Cajun Yard Dog for dinner and it was outstanding. We split the fried calamari as an appetizer, which was absolutely delicious - I loved the creamy cocktail sauce, and it also had some fried okra and even a couple of pieces of fried artichokes in the mix.   For our entrees, I ordered the fried oysters with a crab cake, and a side of mac and cheese and grits. All outstanding! The crab cake was especially good with a spicy sauce on top and a crispy outside.   My husband ordered fried shrimp, blackened Mahi Mahi and a crab cake with a side of sweet fries and Mac and cheese. The Mahi Mahi was delicious and I highly recommend that combined with the crab cakes for the perfect combo.   Service was really good as well. We will definitely be going back! We would have taken pictures of the food but we ate it all too fast!

fmaiUh8ylbVJyrI4LGz8ww.text: So decadent! Had the shrimp and grits - to die for! Also had the chocolate pecan pie a la mode - no words, heavenly! Service - outstanding! Will be back again!

n4_GmS_9bF81SmWHHZsynA.text: Food was good, bartender/owner? was awesome &very helpful . Haven't gotten a chance to visit New Orleans or Mardi Gras this place is cute and decorated so festive...feel like your there! Little kick in almost everything but great! Gumbo full of chicken & some sausage. Catfish with panko breading tasty. Okra great, shocked it was frozen! Jambalaya with chicken & sausage...could use more sausage but yummy. Mac & cheese creamy good & slight kick. Red beans & rice awesome!  Bananas foster was perfect!  Will come back, so much more to try!!  Oh only beer & wine  no liquor

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Fosters
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red beans and rice
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish plate with okra

uPY8ikT0APWtTq0W_TPa8g.text: Went here for dinner on a Friday night.  The place is small and was very crowded so we had to wait for probably 30 minutes.  I had heard good things about this place but ultimately ended up leaving disappointed.  He ordered the crab cakes and I had the grilled chicken.  The chicken did have good flavor but it really needed to be charbroiled - I'm not sure how it was prepared but I just left wondering if they had boiled the chicken and then coated it with the seasoning.  I only ate half of my plate because it was very unappealing.  My husband's crabcakes were good - crispy on the outside.  The remoulade was also tasty.  Overall, I thought it was overpriced and underwhelming.  Likely will not be returning.

i-i47x7xdXkbuUN4ImRqHg.text: Yum. Just Yum. Came here because it was so convenient to shopping and was so surprised by how delicious our lunch was. Had Shrimp and Grits with Collards and my daughter had Red Beans and rice. We will definitely be back. And we didn't get dessert but the bread pudding that was served to the ladies at the next table was beautiful and they raved about it.  We all wanted more as soon as we finished!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

whVXr08Ua61OVEVa5tEEVw.text: I visited a few weeks ago possibly last month because my friend had been craving fried green tomatoes! When we got there we were greeted right away, the waitress was able to give some good tips. We placed out app orders... fried green tomatoes... they were nasty, the breading that was on them was more like a panko breading, the tomatoes themselves were yellow (possibly due the season... maybe). We when ordered food, I ordered the platter that came with fried shrimp and fried catfish strips. I was so excited because I had been craving fried fish (I still am actually) when my plate came out the presentation was horrible! The shrimp did not look like it was cooked all the way, the fish looked to be fine. Against my better judgment I still tried the food! The shrimp was awful the color looked like it was more so tempura fried with no seasonings, the catfish had no seasoning at all. I thought gay since it was a Cajun restaurant there would be something but I was wrong... I sent it back after I took one bit of everything! When we told the waitress she went and got the manager, when the manager came to the table she seemed to be in the defensive side already because her arms were folded and very unwelcoming. My friend explained to her that we did not like our food and that we had sent it back pretty much right after we got it. She then went to say that sending the food back was a waste of food while my friend was explaining that it was a waste of money. The bill was taken care of but it was just a horrible experience. There were other other in the restaurant at the time that seemed to be fine with the food or possibly didn't know any better. This was our experience and we decided not to return again.

9_fVBxLf8mQOCqFul3y8jg.text: Absolutely love this place, best Cajun food in town. We drive almost 45 minutes to go eat here because it's completely worth it.

lOLPiOQ1nHHrkroXoAcIDA.text: The food was so good.  The catfish bites were amazing...melt in your mouth amazing!  The gumbo was delicious.  The fried shrimp and bbq shrimp entrees were excellent, but I definitely would order the fried shrimp next time.  And the best item was a side item...smothered cabbage, OMG!  I've never had cabbage like this before, smothered with Swiss cheese.  I also tried the Mac & Cheese which was great, but I would try another side next time. Lastly, you must try the banana bread pudding with vanilla ice cream to top your meal off!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

po-FvlkbJxzm-rEGpy8_VQ.text: We went here tonight for my husbands birthday and it was unfortunate because we waited for our food for 50 minutes!! Our waitress was not good. The food was great but it just sucks that we had to wait so long to the point that the restaurant cleared out by the time we got our food.

MmTT9BezDvochYEgCQJgmQ.text: I love the theme of the restaurant, super cute. It's was lunch time, so it was a little wait, about ten minutes which wasn't bad. I had the chicken and seafood jambalaya with the smothered cabbage. It was amazing. I never had cheese in my cabbage, but it was surprisingly good. For desert I ordered the bread pudding with a side of ice cream. Amazing!!!!!!!! I will definitely be back to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

JpqX-SAUdbSHAqLJpigFvg.text: This was our sixth visit and thought it was time for a review. On previous visits the fish special and sides have been......OUTSTANDING! Last night I enjoyed the Red Fish special. Despite a small portion, the fish was seasoned perfectly, moist and full of flavor. The entree included fried green tomatoes which were crisp and tasty. My other side, the collard greens were.......Amazing! Service was very good, as usual. On previous visits, Etouffee has been inconsistent based on how busy the CYD is on that particular night. When the house is full my four stars can slip to just two. Sides never disappoint with the Jalapeno Deviled Eggs and Smothered Cabbage joining the greens as a must try! Last night, before 6:00, was a five star experience!  1/14/17 Tried the fried chicken and it was some of the best I ever eaten! Crispy and well breaded while remaking very juicy. These guys know what their doing when it come to their chicken! And the side......see the comments above.

GzqkNVxZ-6ozay7vZwl3ew.text: Loved the catfish and fried shrimp.  Mac & cheese was like that from the family reunion - so good!

pZ-y01ziYfWCrnvr_AIVQg.text: Being that I am from Louisiana... it was nice to finally get some Cajun food home away from home.  The food was OK, it isn't the BEST tasting cajun food. The food was a bit bland, but OK.  I loved their chocolate pecan pie! - I dont really like far stretched sweets... I like my sweets simple, but the pie was good!  The place was also a bit pricey for that little food but great customer service! Very sweet people and atmosphere. I'll come back for their live band on weekends!

QRUK_cy11gKo50m85dNkwQ.text: This place is about as authentic as you can get to New Orleans. It doesn't try to live up to its atmosphere. I can't tell if the people who own the place used to live in New Orleans, but they do act as if they do. I really hate to say that I believe that the place is authentic, as that its decorated with a few beads, and a "burbon street sign." However, the beer lights are authentic [had the new orleans feathers], and the LSU flags were dead on.  Given that it was authentic, the food and service is not fast. I'm not sure if its because the kitchen is slow or if they are meticulous.   The food is simple. The place was packed [at lunch on a Monday]. The food had a small kick to it. The prices do seem a little high, but the portions are large. If you get a poboy, there will be a lot on your plate, enough for more than one meal. Additionally, given a no/low carb diet, you can ask for the rice&beans to be without the rice. Awesome! This place is comparable to my diet, close to where I work and live, and is close to average for a decent plate of food. I'm sold!  I had the catfish, and I liked it. I dinned with family members [who had never had Cajun food before] and they liked it as well.  Lastly: The TVs. Typically I abhor a television at a restaurant, but the sound was muted   and it didn't really take away from the atmosphere. People were happy to be here, liked the food, and were happy to be around each other.

nLb7tz-yEmrXeu-B4HzBvA.text: Smothered cabbage.   I almost want to end this review with those two words. Smothered freakin' cabbage.   If you haven't had the smothered cabbage, you are missing the True meaning of life. I can't even properly describe it, as the description won't do it justice. No matter how many times I wash my hands, my fingers are not clean enough to type of the holy deliciousness that is Cajun Yard Dog smothered cabbage. It's something like cheese sauce that the cabbage is in...I'm not sure what that stuff is, really, but it's GOOD.  There's all kinds of wonderful cajun specialties, and the menu also has a few Southern classics, like the pimento cheese plate. I enjoy the pickled vegetable salad as well. Their prices are reasonable, the service is good, and the decor is as charming as anywhere I've been in Charlotte.

Z2X31ILKNebk7uNzurrn4Q.text: So solid and crispy reliable.  I have no idea if this is authentic Cajun food and I really don't give a shit.  All that matters is, this is tasty eats.  Check it out if you are in the mood for some fried semi-greasy goodness.

Xvrx2aHjPQZx89iN_j5dpQ.text: On the very enthusiastic reviews of Rebekah, Joy, and others, we headed to the Cajun Yard Dog last night and it was as good as advertised.  The staff was one of the best and most friendly in Charlotte.  The gumbo and jambalaya was very good and, as Joy so fervently reported, the smothered cabbage was excellent.  We finished it off with a fresh buttermilk pie which was absolutely delicious.    Great staff, delicious food, cozy ambiance and Abita on draft.  What else could you ask for?

8yP7646o3rWz1UWDWrmnYA.text: Cajun food is supposed to be flavorful and spicy right? Well not at Cajun Yard Dog. We tried the etouffee and jambalaya and Neither has much taste to it. Very dumbed down. They are also quite skimpy on the seafood. Service was slow for lunch because it seemed like only one waitress ran the restaurant.

9Pk5z8W1s3N1mi6n72Hppw.text: I became a big fan of Red Oak (beer) because they have it on tap here.  I'm not a huge beer fan but I would definitely recommend it!  I LOVE their shrimp po boys and I recently tried the gumbo.  Big portions and great prices.  Also, I am down with the buffet of hot sauces!  they don't make things too spicey...so if the thought of hot Cajun cuisine scares you (because you are a baby kitty...) no worries.  This is a great spot!

BCoatp4VkUvq91js926Izg.text: One of my favorites in Charlotte!  You will find fantastic southern fare and seafood & delicious authentic cajun dishes here.  I never leave disappointed...or without eating way too much.  A few of my favorite dishes: the pimiento cheese and pickled beets appetizer is incredible.  I'd never be one to order pickled beets but they're awesome and the pimiento cheese is perfect.  There are great sandwich selections (shrimp po' boys, catfish, fried chicken ....) but my favorites are the platters.  You'll get a huge helping of your choice of fried oysters, shrimp, chicken, blackened mahi...the list of mouthwatering choices goes on and on...and then you also get a choice of two yummy southern-style sides.  Mac n' cheese, collards, smothered cabbage, sweet potato fries....seriously it will take you a hot minute to decide between all the menu choices.  Lucky for us, there's a pick two platter option if you can't choose between fried oysters and blackened mahi--yes please!  I'm always part of the clean plate club here, so I've only been able to try dessert twice (pretty sure I was pregnant both times!) but no surprise it was amazing.  Loved the bread pudding with bourbon sauce and their pecan pie.  The atmosphere is fun--a small restaurant with tons of New Orleans gear hanging everywhere--beads, alligators, beer signs, etc.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  I've never had to wait more than a few minutes before someone comes over to take drink orders.  There's a good beer selection and a fun bar with sports channels.  Nothing goes better with some friend oysters than a nice cold beer and some SEC football!  There is limited seating, so it can be tough during the busiest dinner hours.  But remember, good things come to those who wait!

iyCKcQzEPOizC8KMr37FVA.text: Small place in Arboretum out-door mall. Great food! Reasonable to lower prices. Some unique low-country/Cajun dishes. Live music on Fri. and Sat. evening. Get there early the band has their own following!

7v1g-dxwy4dFQvJM795dcQ.text: I should try this place more often. The first and second times were pretty good experiences for me. Sometimes they're busy so it takes a few minutes before a server starts things out for you. The food is great, the interior is fancy and decorated with lots of Mardi Gras things. The sign is very bright neon yellow which is easy to find. The green beans a bit weird though, I wouldn't try those again. They mix it with something else which takes away the taste of the green beans.  The inside is a bit small though, limiting the seating if it's crowded.

pLI9LHuYLYIinTSZQQw5uQ.text: Great fried chicken.  Crispy and not greasy -- perfectly cooked.  The sides are good, but not great.  I agree with another reviewer about the green beans -- they're ok but they put some ingredient in there that isn't quite right -- maybe sugar???  The etoufee is also very good.  Lesser favorites are the blackened meatloaf and the chicken cordon bleu.  Great comfort food and great, friendly service.

a4QQaQuaqapqXQR19sAQgA.text: I consider myself a connoisseur of fried food.  And while that may not strike some people as anything to brag about, Cajun Yard Dog acts as proof that there is a right and a wrong way to fry.  And by God, they do it right.  I could go on for pages about this place, as it's certainly my personal favorite in Charlotte.  But I'll simply mention the sides, service and the beer.  Most entrees are accompanied by 2 sides.  Those sides range from collared greens to sweet potato fries, from gumbo (extra $) to some of the best mac and cheese I've ever eaten.    The service isn't always fast.  But even someone as picky as I am about service will be pleased by the friendly, knowledgeable waiters.   The beer selection is pretty phenomenal for a place of this breed.  Lagers, Ambers, Fruit beers (including Purple Haze from Louisiana's Abita) Porters, Stouts,etc.  Basically, even micro brew drinkers can consistently find a beer that they've never tried.    If you enjoy spicy food, fried food, good food or good beer, do yourself a favor and try Cajun Yard Dog: Charlotte's creole connection.

nVDtN2tPVmHJA1HmXbixhg.text: Fresh house-made salad dressings, warm and crisp fried oysters, and tasty fish!  The food is fantastic, the atmosphere fun, and the service is friendly.  My friend and I have had 2 fun ladies' lunches here and we will keep coming back.  I bring the little guy and he LOVES the cheesy grits and okra!!!

8lc4wLqLt2zU3ZEGoi05og.text: This is a very small restaurant beside Michaels in the Arboetum Shopping Center.  We adore this restaurant.  Try the fried okra, fried oysters, shrimp pasta, collard greens.  Get a vegetable platter.  Go early as seating is limited.  You may want to google their hours of operation too.   We have been fans for a very long time!

E9w9Grt0RAgkl9nje0Y6MA.text: Wow, what a let down. I've read so many of these great reviews, I had to try this place out. Met my daughter for dinner here tonight. The place is small but comfortable. It was busy although we didn't have to wait. I ordered the chicken & andouille sausage  jambalaya w/ mac & cheese and my daughter got the crab cake po boy w/ sweet potato fries. My daughter's meal looked great and she said it tasted good too. The sweet potato fries were alright. My meal was a different story. The jambalaya was bland and must have been put on the plate too early because it was luke warm when it arrived. The portions were small and overpriced (14 bucks for the jambalaya). The mac & cheese was the saving grace. It was damn good. I will go back again but will have to try some other dishes. The service was very friendly.

guBSFIlAwuDxKsyhWbTCgQ.text: Love this joint in the Arboretum, uber casual eatery where you can count on a good po' boy NoLa style anyday. A favorite for a lazy Saturday lunch for us, a seat yourself kinda place most days, with a fair selection of microbrews for a place so small. Hot sauces abound at the bar (past what's on your table already), just ask the bartender to pass one over to you! Mac and Cheese side....yum! And plenty of other sides (lots like Okra, collards....) to choose from. The Gumbo the last time we were there? Delicious! This is a favorite of ours, make it one of yours too (just don't go when we need a table- ha!)

wg23fqmxoY9WMnFI-m-6TA.text: The place is really as good as it gets.  If you like your food a little on the spicy side and enjoy a laid back but cool setting you should give this place a try.  I mean seriously, everything on the menu is fantastic.  They have everything Cajun/creole, from seafood dishes to red beans and rice.  It's a pretty small place so if you have a big group you might want to call ahead, but if you're looking for a nice place to hang out or even a romantic place to take your significant other give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

p_CL5kPTPhrNAJYfgr90ng.text: Cajun - Smajun - this place rocks!  Cabbage is to die for!  Quirky wines and unknown beers are there for the adventurous.  Lynn is a hoot - ask her for beets next time you are in (inside joke).  Their pimento cheese could bring world peace!  A must try but an even bigger repeat performance restaurant - eat here regularly and have never had anything but the best!

2mZCqM4GYVvpJXe8jSrqOg.text: One of the worst meals I have ever eaten. We usually go to the Cajun Queen, but some friends wanted to try this place. I ordered the shrimp etouffee since I normally get the barbecue shrimp dinner or etouffee at the Queen and figured that would be a good pick. When it came out, it looked like can gravy was just poured all over the dish. That's pretty much what it tasted too...no spice, no flavor just blah. This was the first time I had to get something to eat after going to a restaurant. I will not be returning.

LxP3uo1Pb749PQYxZmWeIQ.text: Great food (blackened red fish was AMAZING), and excellent service. Fun for the whole family. Definitely going back!!!

5BxznGTm-CLGcdsgtWPoxg.text: Love it! The service is always great the food is even better! There is a wait sometimes, but it's definitely worth it! The people are nice a really homie place!

oTPoI4Gn1tXr9nqwl0xXDA.text: Absolutely deserving of 5 stars.  Not just because the food was amazing, but also because this place is a little tucked away.(alot of people we talked to in town don't even know this is a sit down restaurant! Criminal!).  That's mostly the fault of whoever decorated the outside.  In desperate need of a change to their facade to attract attention.  Notables: -beer menu has a lot of unique options.  and 3.50 each one! -great choice of sides.  our favs were the cheese grits and fried okra. -all 3 entrees we had were amazing.  cooked really well and used really high quality ingredients.  People, just go, okay?  this place is way better than it looks.

rRvUn3KQ_svDqAAs5QWoMQ.text: This place is too good not to shout about.  We waited about 20 minutes on Friday night around 5:50 for a table at this adorable restaurant that makes you feel like you are part of the family. Sat at the bar with friendly bartender, Graham seated us and consistently checked on us throughout the meal.  Lynn was our server, this woman works hard but still has time to talk to the regulars and make first timers feel welcome.  Then there is the food, the food is really good.  We started with the fried mushrooms and BBQ shrimp and grits.  The biggest, most delicate mushrooms we have ever had, accompanied with a homemade horseradish sauce.  The shrimp and grits were also amazing, we had to take over half of it home, because the portion was big.  We ordered the Crawfish Etouffee, the sauce was fantastic, the rice perfect (I prefer Crawfish when in season March - June) I think shrimp would have been a better choice, however my companion loved it.   The Chicken Cordon Bleu, was great.  Light crispy fried chicken, with Swiss, ham, and a sauce that was out of this world good.  I believe the owner/manager stopped to talk to everyone in the place, including us and was extremely friendly and bragged about the generous portions.  We will be enjoying our leftovers for lunch today and then hitting the gym to work it all off.  This is a great, casual, family dining place.  No frills, no pretension, just a Big Easy kind of place to grab great meal with great people.

Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried mushroom, Horseradish and Ranch sauce

M7qhZoSzpurxvjYvskpRbA.text: Brought home a 16pc box this evening based on friends' assurances it was some of best in Charlotte. I found the chicken to be devoid of spice and way over cooked.  Maybe they were having an off night, but there is no way that I would order fried chicken here again . However, the collard greens and Mac n cheese were quite good.

ejbrVJwyqBzc6cFxzkIG0Q.text: Always ggreat!!  too small location so wait line can be long.  Been going to CYD for 13 years.

_OcT4kY1Sy_AS2gBXyD0AA.text: Pros - Red beans and rice, shrimp po' boy, fried okra, bread pudding, and RED OAK beer.   Cons - Really bad live music.  Solid little joint serving good food and cold beer. Service has always been good as well.

0E0Jo72p4r2LUBKbd0oMAw.text: Amazing. This place rocked. Definitely fair priced and everything was cooked perfectly

-2rlXHOFd2NGIeszfNt5Vg.text: Let me start off by saying that my only reason for giving Cajun Yard Dog 4 out of 5 stars is that they do not offer beignets.  And honestly I have only found one Cajun restaurant, not located in Louisiana, that offered beignets.  I feel like they are a staple of Cajun cuisine.  Ok, rant aside, the restaurant is small, and they do not have a hostess that greets you and takes your name if there is a wait.  When you arrive and walk in there is a yellow pad of paper sitting on an entry table that you add your name to and the number in your party.  It's best to arrive early if you do not want to wait to be seated.  We did not know this when we arrived and there were about six parties ahead of us, however, we chose to wait as our mouths were watering for some Cajun/creole.  And we were so glad we did!  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.  I ordered the chicken and andouille jambalaya, my husband had the red beans and rice and my father ordered the blackened mahi.  By the time we sat down and ate it was late and the waitress returned to the table to explain that they were out of mahi but could substitute tilapia.  He was not at all disappointed by the substitution.  In addition to our entrees we were each given the option of two sides.  I had the fried okra and the green beans.  The okra was delicious and I assume they must have used the same batter that they use on their fried chicken that all the yelpers talk about.  Delicious.  And the green beans were spot on, cooked perfectly keeping their bright green color while still having a little crunch.  Mixed in with the green beans were slivered almonds, if you have a nut allergy be sure to mention it as it does not indicate that the dish contains nuts on the menu.  The restaurant is decorated with Louisiana flare making you feel like you are in a cafe on Bourbon Street.  The noise level is high, which is not unexpected given the size.  There is a bar with seating for approximately 9, if you don't care to wait for a table keep an eye open for space at the bar.  The restaurant also offers carry out!  Happy to have found a little slice of Louisiana in Charlotte.  We will surely return.

IeAt_EzpPfMi8ehOfbt3-w.text: This was my first time here! I had the FGBLT (blt with fried green tomatoes).  It was delicious! The atmosphere is cozy and fun.  The service was excellent.   The right combo of efficiency and friendly!!  I'm only sad it's not closer to my house.

icN26NVloUFJApGIDrZJHQ.text: Food was great! Had the grouper blackened. Also enjoyed the craft beer selection. Unfortunately there was only one server for the whole restaurant and service could've been quicker. Still recommend this place none the less.

v9_kW0wijtXPZT2oJeAX1Q.text: We actually have a real cajun yard dog, and even she wouldn't eat the leftovers. Seriously, some of the worst cajun food on the planet. I've tried cajun food in many different cities and this stuff is bottom of the barrel, especially at these prices.   If you like bland overcooked under-spiced cajun food, this is THE place to eat. I tried the Jambalaya. It came out mushy, very bland and had a strange orange-ish hue. Folks, Jambalaya is a dirty rice dish..Not supposed to be mushy, orange and certainly not bland.    Charlotte needs a real cajun restaurant. So far all the available choices are underwhelming.

5bXhDXwlduHcoAPa4niwog.text: Lynn was our server and she was terrific. This was our first time to Cajun Yard Dog and it was a great experience. The chicken & seafood jambalaya was delicious and filling. The fried chicken was so delicious too.  Mac n' cheese makes a great side. If you get a dessert, try the bread pudding (so good). Great atmosphere and great people add to the wonderful experience at Cajun Yard Dog.

39LgGSEXIa2cPOU2PticRA.text: Love this place.  Best etouffee in Charlotte.  Great fried chicken.  Great sides.  Their smothered cabbage is like nothing you have tasted.

S7QWTIr32I2KTTDHE_v9vQ.text: Been here a few times in the past since the "new" ownership took over a few years ago.  Hadn't been there for a while... decided to return with the family for dinner.  I was SHOCKED to see how much the prices had risen.  I've worked in several professional kitchens.  I understand food costs, profit margins, etc.  Trust me, WAY overpriced.  Needless to say, I was disappointed.  I gathered the family and left as soon as I saw the menu...something I've never done.  Like I said, the food's alright.  I respect the individual restaurateur, usually some of the hardest working people you'll meet.  But, I work hard for my money too.  CYD, you're gonna have to do better than that.

NgT7HEbrRim1Pj5TVkTndw.text: Cajun Yard Dog is a great restaurant. I had the fried catfish. It comes with jalapeno tartar sauce and two sides (of which there are many). I chose the mac and cheese and the sweet potato fries. For dessert, have the bananas foster. Awesome!

RB6fVRHE_xGzDMM_xSsvDg.text: With my visit to the city my friend recommended this place. I've only had one previous experience with Creole/Lousiana style food and it was painfully (pun intended) so. I was hoping that this new experience would turn me towards the light of Creole/Cajun food. Meh, not so much.   We ordered a app, essentially fried okra, calamari and artitchoke and on the menu it said it was to be served with a remoulade. First, I do have to admit everything was fried nicely- even the calamari. Typically most resturants cannot fry calamari correctly to save their asses. Cajun Yard Dog (CYD) did this well. The amusing thing that happened when our waitress dropped off our app is the 3 of us instantly noticed that dipping sauce was no remoulade by anymeans. It looked more like ketchup and mayo mixxed together because it was not throughly combined before placed in the ramekin. I was already hesitant to taste it just because of the unappealing appearance of this sauce. After we all tasted it, we concluded it tasted like cocktail sauce with mayo mixxed in. I did not use the dipping sauce after that and simply ate the app on its own.   I ordered the crawfish etouffee. When I ordered it I was really walking into it blind. I knew I wanted to try something different and I've actually heard of a etouffee. But I figured crawfish, rice in a sauce, it really cannot be too bad. I got my etouffee with a side of collards. My friends got a meat gumbo and a blackened chicken po'boy.   First appearance of my plate I was taken aback. There was a very hearty helping of crawfish indeed. But the sauce was a very dark brown murky looking color with bright red crawfish atop and small scoop (albeit) white rice underneath it with a small saucer of collards placed next to it. Appearance is not everything in food, I've learned that. Jumping headfirst into tasting it because I was eager to see what this etouffee was supposed to taste like, I took a large bite. First taste impression? I thought it tasted like sort of a muddy river. It reminded me of watered down dirt. It did not taste like much else so I covered it in the hot sauce they had sitting on the table hoping I'd like it more. I did. About 20 so splashes of hot sauce it was more appealing to me. My collards were a disappointment. I love collards. A school friend from back home prided himself on cooking 'soul' food well, and he does. His collards I can still remember the flavor and texture. Just soft enough where the leaves would melt, but the stems need to be slightly chewed and a delicious bacon-veggie flavor. I got none of that from my CYD collards. I thought the collards could have been cooked a little bit longer and it needed more overall flavor.   I had a small taste of my friends gumbo, she did not say much. So I guess it was not much to talk about. The blackened chicken po' boy was a very hearty size. I did not ask about the taste, but he seemed fine with his sandwich.   Though CYD has not turned me off from Cajun/Creole cusine I am still saddened I cannot find or understand what this love of spicy, heavily season cajun/creole food when all the food I've tasted has not been spicy and or even that flavorful to me.

-I5NpyIdluBFWZJh70zksw.text: The food is really good, esp. the beans & rice. The bread pudding is good & enough for two. The moscato wine is good. My biggest complaint is that one of the female servers always looks as if she'd rather be anywhere but at work. And she always looks that way. She's a long-time employee & if she reads this she knows who she is. Cheer up, you bring people down!

o10xf3imkeb24XK2ZVDdDQ.text: I can't believe it took me so long to give this place a try but omg! Everything I've tried since has been great but the fried chicken is some of the best I've ever had.

2-QyiZnDCYvRs0WcRIUmdQ.text: Change of ownership.   Maybe I caught them on a bad day.  They were having air conditioning issues and the restaurant was hot.  Most of the former employees were gone.  The food seemed to have dropped a notch in quality.  I will give them one more try.

ygFsQRm3bOKZTztNi65uxA.text: A friend and I ate there a week ago. We are still mad about the service and qulity of the food.  I had the cajun pasta which had bad shrimp in it and the waitress did not care. My friend had cajun meatloaf and parts were harder than a brick.  We did not get served for 40 minutes and staff was unapologetic.

trg7wLOJr5Ik9nCl1bIBYg.text: My spouse and I went for dinner and really weren't impressed. The food was very salty and a bit over cooked for my liking. The staff is nice and very friendly. They are great at making you feel at home. The portions are very good for the price. I don't think that we will return because of the seasoning issue.

qK-s6It_Zq9Xa7nmTO9aKA.text: By far one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. It's mouth watering good. Highly recommend the catfish, fried chicken, mashed potatoes, and collard greens. Be prepared to wait though - this place is always busy but well worth it!

1P5DiSMEV2-YXuJpgmTY4g.text: I was very dissatisfied with the place and I had heard such great things about it my service was terrible I'm not sure if she was having a bad day or what but she was very inattentive I disliked the food as well everything I ordered was bland only thing good to me was the chocolate pecan pie

HI3PP8kcD5mr2SAhwHqVGQ.text: Relaxing, affordable, pleasant wait staff.  Nice little get away. Fun spot for a delicious meal and refreshing drink. Check it out!

KXzaCha6X3mE6n5YXrSp_g.text: One of my go to restaurants. Cozy atmosphere. Always feel welcome. Love the specials they offer. Have tried most everything on the menu.

Qjce1eA2TSlk3T3_Wr2kIA.text: This is my favorite Cajun restaurant in Charlotte! The food is fresh and authentic. I love to come here on Fat Tuesday (Mardi Gras)! The fried green tomato appetizer is delicious. Sometimes they have gator bites and these are definitely worth a try. Crab cakes and the seafood are delicious. The Po'boys are also a worthy meal choice. The smothered cabbage is unreal. I have to have this side every time I come. Really good banana's foster for dessert. You can have some NOLA beers. Don't pass by this little eatery in the Arboretum. Stop in today and see what all the fuss is about!

OtwG1CvitPv7B9qYQ_-dkA.text: Consistently great food. Highly recommend. I usually get the blackened salmon with two of their delish sides. My son ventures out more and tries new things. He's always loved what he gets too. Along with the consistently great food comes the consistently long wait to be seated but I guess that's par for the course!

f6qzlNuZ6bJ8rXo0hEQbtQ.text: This is a must visit place for me when I'm in town.  I always get the shrimp and grits and have never been let down.  Service is always friendly and prompt.  I would highly recommend the Cajun Yard Dog!!

YuCBHUs2ZP5-MLmUYhN7zQ.text: Have nothing bad to say...   The BBQ Shrimp and Grits(Appetizer size) is really enough for one person. I can't imagine what the entree size looks like. Perhaps that's best for 2 people. This dish is similar to the one at Cajun Queen. Its not spicy but the flavor is still on point. The grits were creamy and there was just enough sauce for some bread if needed. Would have liked some more sauce but it's all good.   The Fried Green Tomatoes are a bit under seasoned. Throw a bit of salt in those bad boys and we're in business. My Homie likened this dish to eggplant Parmesan with some crunch.  The service was top notch. Our waitress was very attentive even checking on us when we were done with our dishes and she collected them. I think the manager or owner (?) came over to make sure everything was okay with our meals. Stellar service... Smiles, patience, attentiveness... These are a few of my favorite things when it comes to service.   I'll have to come back with the dude to try some of their other tasty dishes.

ZnhfxQ-xGgvgfcT8u5n9gQ.text: Solid 3 star.  Nothing over the top, but nothing subpar either.  Not a bad place to grab lunch.  The service here is very attentive and engaging.

wJBNORWl2B1hEOmgOc7PLw.text: It's like be transported many miles to New Orleans, Louisiana. The etoufee and jambalaya were authentic and nicely spiced, the seafood combos were plentiful, and the beer selection was great. Don't let its location in a shopping center steer away

SC0IVeO9MZP6ThhLRbgwvg.text: My husband and I finally tried this place after having it Bookmarked for years.  I will have to say we were SURPRISED and far from disappointed. I am giving this place a 4 star rating because I personally couldn't eat much as it was still my first trimester of my pregnancy and my tastebuds were off but my husband and I have similar taste so I know that my pregnancy was causing some of my taste to be off plus I was still at the point of not holding food down and just experimenting to see what I can get with.  We ordered several apps and our server suggested the house made yard sauce which I mixed with the sauce that came with the fried oysters per her suggestion and man did it fix my tastebuds with all the food I ate (yum yummy sauce). After eating apps my husband noticed a chicken fried over at another table that the man seemed to have inhaled so he asked our server about it and was told that it's their number one seller. My husband immediately ordered it and the server let him know that it would take 20-25 minutes or more as it's cooked fresh and he was okay with that. The chicken arrived looking so wonderfully crisp and he and my son dived in and ate it down to the bone. My husband says it was the best fried chicken he has had since we moved to NC and he has been talking about returning for a long time now so we may have to make the trip over really soon. My only hang up about this place is the lack of compassion for those who don't eat pork. I mean I have Louisiana roots and even in Louisiana there are options to not have pork adolli or pork included in gumbo, etoufee, etc.. Those options are limited here as my family are none pork eaters and recently I have become vegetarian20%/Vegan 80% so I'm not sure I'll be able to eat anything here the next visit I'll be there to take pictures of my husband food and take his opinions to heart.

xgbuFpC27WlIwBr5oWbhDw.text: I highly recommend Cajun Yard Dog. I honestly consider it to be the best Cajun food in charlotte, even better than Cajun queen. The service is very attentive. The menu is authentically Louisiana, complete with abita root beer(the best) and abita beers. The vibe is casual and energetic. I had the fried oyster po boy and it was great! Shrimp and grits were also excellent. I can't wait to come back and try out more of the menu!

S3HN3AMYdc5fE4O1JWlEsg.text: We ordered the deviled eggs, crawfish etouffee, and the chicken jambalaya.   The deviled eggs were super tasty and had a nice kick from the jalapeno that made for a unique twist on a common dish.  The etouffee was pretty good and had a ton of crawfish but I thought the chicken jambalaya was better.  The macaroni and cheese was out of this world delicious.  Service was friendly and good.  It was definitely a casual restaurant but definitely delicious food.

-ROTs6l4rFZJJ6nWimL9zw.text: I was truly not expecting the quality of food I received. Cajun yard dog is a hole in the wall kind of place. I didn't even know it existed until I just happened to go to Michaels one day for some craft supplies. They should really consider getting a location that is more visible. The salmon was amazing! It tasted so fresh. I will definitely go again.

WIFMAVfVyYz6CFwzdWm6HA.text: Well, first the sanitation rating is 90%. The wait list is sign your self in. Definitely a first. Very friendly casual environment. The tables are so close that the waitress kept bumping me.   Our waitress was very friendly and engaging.   Ordered fried green tomatoes for apps. Delish.   Entree it all went to hell. Ordered the Chicken Cordon Blue. It was more like fried chicken with a slice of ham slapped on top with some kind of cheese corn sauce. It looked and tasted unappealing. The waitress was very accommodating and switched out my meal for seafood gumbo. The seafood was OK but the rioux was salty.   It was a packed restaurant so obviously, i got the wrong meal! would go back and try something different.  3 stars for the friendly waitress and owner that came around to tables to check on customers.

i-5SqtAtcJy0HlDgQGc28Q.text: NOM .COM!!! This place is really really good. I've been coming here for about 10 years, and haven't been disappointed yet. The fried chicken is probably the best chicken I've ever had in my entire life. The place is really small, and there's always a short wait to get in, but it's definitely worth it. Definitely the best Cajun place in the area, and probably one of the best places in general in my opinion.

W97-nxcrC2CnaL1r3bCa8g.text: Celebrating my son's forthcoming 14th bday.   His choice was this place largely for the fried oysters and Cajun  did not  disappoint.   Two orders of fried oysters and fried shrimp.   My wife loved the shrimp bc the breading is so light. Service was great too.

ZNWqtv4ZsDXAylUQbooZkw.text: I am still a fan of the Cajun Yard Dog, but on my most recent visit, I did notice a couple of things that have gone downhill...which is why I dropped to 3 stars instead of 4 stars as in my previous review.    For starters, the place really needs to expand a bit...either with more regular table seating or a bigger bar that will accommodate more people. The wait times are just getting really long based on my last couple of visits.   Most recently, we arrived between 6-6:15 on a Friday, and had a 45-55 minute wait for a table.  This wouldn't be too terribly bad if there was sufficient room at the bar, or in the "waiting area" but neither is the case.   My S.O. had suggested we leave and go somewhere else, but I was really craving some Cajun food.  So he was a good sport, and agreed to wait.   When we were finally seated, we pretty much knew what we were going to order.  To start, we had an order of calamari.  I would not order this again. Our order was made up of less than 1/2 calamari and the rest was just the breaded fried okra and breaded fried onion. A little of that would be ok, but I would have liked to see more calamari.  On the plus side, I don't normally love remoulade,  but the stuff they served along with the calamari & okra was very tasty.   So, for my entree, I got the usual - shrimp etoufee with fried okra on the side. Usually this is my favorite combination... but honestly, they were just a bit off tonight. 1) If I had known how much fried okra they included in the appetizer, I would have ordered a different side item. 2) the Fried Okra was not as delicious as usual... it was a bit flat - it tasted sort of like the frozen stuff I buy at the grocery store. And 3) my biggest disappointment was my entree.  Usually, the etoufee is super flavorful, and very generous portion size. This time, my plate was full of rice, but the etoufee itself was a bit on the sparse side and not as flavorful as normal. I hope this is an anomaly, and that next time the quality & quantity is back up to par.   Our service was a-ok, considering how swamped they were. Oh, and kudos for the beer menu  - they always have a nice selection of different beers on the board.

RZhU1tqrmsPKoeMfhZD30g.text: The fried chicken is to die for and the Mac and cheese will make you like your plate. I love finding these little gems in my home town!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

TfV6bcw3Yjabpkq3a3Lm2Q.text: Small and intimate joint with limited seating and a modest beer and wine bar. Everything was on point. The Shrimp and Grits were rich and flavorful, with a hint of beer, jalapeno and Cajun spices. They were complemented by wonderful collard greens and smashed potatoes. No problems, but the portions could have been bigger. Since I live right across the street and expectations were pleasantly exceeded, I'll make it a point to come back.

20ct7cWS3Gk3-BgDKOrS8Q.text: We were looking for a restaurant close to my friends house and found Cajun. I asked the waiter about the most popular Po-boy and he suggested the shrimp. So I ordered the shrimp Po-boy with the smash potatoes and a side of the pickled beets. My friend had the fried shrimp, collards and fried okras. The Po-boy was larger than I expected and was delicious with just the right amount of shrimp, tomatoes and lettuce. The pickled beets was one of the best I have had from a restaurant, and plenty of them. My friend had the shrimp and they were large jumbo shrimp that wasn't heavily dipped in batter. The were light and flakey. She said the collards were good. I didn't taste them because they were  cooked in pork. A good night and a good choice of restaurants.  The only bad thing was waiting for a table and waiting for our food. I'm glad we didn't order an appetizer because we took home another serving of food.

rxXgkNyo6GuTyqb53B-yFA.text: Ok..I am from Charlotte actually Matthews...why in the world I haven't been here before is beyond me. Outstanding crawfish and shrimp pasta. Great craft beer..great service..cool atmosphere. We missed the line at the door but I know why it was there. I will be back many more times with friends. Yahay..for me finding this place! !!

ZGfF_l3-mhkbM81xDkSOaw.text: This place is awesome! Stopped in for a quick lunch while house shopping from out of town. The staff were all super friendly and gave excellent suggestions. The blackened corvina fish was excellent, as were the macaroni and cheese and sweet potato fires (to die for!). Will definitely return!

VaXu6dA3J_VNeosCeJi_sg.text: Sean, Brayden and I had a great experience on Sat. for Sean's bday dinner. The small place is in a strip mall, decorated very cute with a Mardi Gras theme, the wait wasn't too bad, but we came early, 6:15pm. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She has been there for 14 years! We had the chicken seafood jambalaya with fried okra, fried chicken, smothered cabbage, fried shrimp, and mac n cheese. There wasn't anything that wasn't awesome!! The dog sauce was flavorful and not too spicy. It was great on the fried chicken, but the chicken was so good by itself. Even the blueberry and blackberry cobbler with ice cream was delicious. The chocolate Pecan pie was not as moist as we thought it could be, but it was still delicious. We also bought a tshirt as a souvenir.

T5GzFaWvze9wzuxnPJ7x2Q.text: We love this place! By our second visit we had met the owner so by our third visit he knew our names. Wait staff and owner did all the could to make sure we enjoyed our meal. Food has been great each time: blackened salmon, shrimp/andouille pasta and the Seafood Jambalaya all were amazing! Def one of our favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mardi Gras Bread Pudding
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Salmon with Mac n Cheese and Fried Okra

Qk9Uj-AzV9QLQR7L8IINsg.text: This place is amazing. My mother in law took me here for lunch one day and I have a seafood allergy, but the staff and cooks took great care of me. They told me the foods that I should stay away from and told me that they would cook my food separately so I wouldn't have a reaction. I know it was hard with all of the seafood but thank you for taking great care of me :) We will definitely be back.

_FPKV5j404pq2ah94ZFbXQ.text: Found this hole in the wall. Everything we ate was delicious. Mac n cheese is top 3 best I've ever had. Definitely will be returning! Keep it up.

YfSxnIu4bdENHhtl7liGdg.text: One of my favorite places in town. I always come on a  Saturday and get the chicken & waffles. Well actually I get a double order of chicken. And judging by the reaction of the staff, I'm the only one who orders double.   In doing so I had the pleasure of meeting and talking to the chief a few times. I will continue to come here for a long time. I couldn't be more pleased with the service and the quality of food. Small restaurant with great staff and spectacular food.  I have also had the fresh mahi one evening, absolutely wonderful as well.  Thanks  From the Guy who gets double chicken

Kl7ppB9NfZgGRFQqMdiggA.text: New ownership at this place,  however the food is as good as my prior visits.  On my previous  review I gave it four stars because the place was starting to look run down and dirty  and the health score had dropped as well. That's not the case anymore. It looks cleaner and the health score has gone up too.  Will definitely be coming back.

--HsltjHyBbgWs05o9RwtA.text: I guess coming from NY, I have high expectations when it comes to flavor and cajun food. Sadly, I didn't think this was as good as it is hyped up to be. The southern charm is real though.. employees and waitstaff are super friendly but the food itself has been made to please the pallet of the southern people. Do not expect True, authentic or spicy, deep ingredient cajun food here.

Uvx-X2WSdtDv2GbPVxjKAQ.text: Awesome crab cakes!!!!  Getting 4 stars only due to a tiny waiting area and a lengthy wait at times. Call ahead

ST1c6cgBYIE_D95Ct6CDMQ.text: Absolutely amazing! Had never heard of this place, and a friend took us out for lunch. Great environment and service. Ordered the chicken and seafood jambalaya, it was delicious!

mpI7tx54KgQxZFgd42XosQ.text: I had a seafood craving and did my Yelp research on this place.  It was seat yourself and it took a bit to get anyone to the table even though the dining area was almost empty, so of course I'm sititing there freaking out wondering if this was a good idea while checking out the distressed walls, some TVs, and a non-overpowering Mardi Gras theme.  Not sure what was my apprehension because I was overwhelmingly pleased with Everything! I had to try one of everything, but settled on the shrimp platter, meatloaf po boy, etouffee, and seafood jambalaya.  Like I said, everything was good, but let's focus on the that meatloaf. My sons have never had a real po boy, which in my experience has always been a battered fried seafood.  I asked our server her recommendation and she "promised" the meatloaf version would be worth it.  Oh, if I could eat one of these every day!!!  I'm also a beer girl and had a little bit of trouble navigating the list, as it was just the labels and not the style of beer, but again my knowedgable server was able to assist.  I had a refreshing german pilsner while waiting for the food to arrive but switched to a New Orleans Dixie lager with the remainder of our meal.  I liked it so much I went to the store and bought a sixer!   The staff was so nice! The food - I guarantee (I hope you read that in your best Justin Wilson voice)  And Get There EARLY because by the time we finished this place was packed and a line was going out the door!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dixie beer
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood jambalaya w mac n cheese
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp étouffée n potato salad

VqzQty7zcnHv3JhPRPZytw.text: The food was okay, but it took almost an hour to get our food after we ordered it.  When the food was finally brought to us, we still had to wait for a side that was being "made to order."  Really, it takes over an hour to boil some noodles and make a watery cheese sauce for mac and cheese in a small side dish bowl?  The unsweetened tea had gone bad and I had to send it back.  My friend was brought the wrong beverage and then argued with when she said it wasn't what she ordered.  The owner was nice and apologized about our wait when we told him our problems, but we were only offered a free dessert after being told about their small kitchen and a large to-go order that had come in slowing down the restaurant.  At that point, we just wanted to leave.    This was my first experience at this restaurant.  I had heard good things, but good things wasn't my experience.  I hope they were just having an off day.Not sure I'd go back.

4R1D9_Bq51n3cBM6fxdgAA.text: I recently moved to Charlotte from L.A. and was looking for a good spot in my new neighborhood.  My son and I saw the yellow sign and walked in.  This was a month and a half ago.  Since then, we've been back at least 4 times.  I could go every week..but my son wants to "eat healthy."  Yeah...good for you.  The staff is always friendly..personable....with the charm that I didn't find that often at L.A. Restaurants.     The first meal I had was the fried catfish with jalapeno tartar sauce and greens and potato salad.  Loved the catfish..the greens were pretty good and the salad was okay...a little too much mayo though.  Since then I've had the blackened mahi...it was just okay.  I think it could have used a bit more seasoning.  Every time I've gone, I've seen people eating the fried chicken.  Finally yesterday, I tried it.  I'm a dark meat person.  It was great! I had a leg and a thigh.  The seasoning was just right...the crunch was...crunchy.  I had to tell the waitress how much I enjoyed .  She said they have a to go box.  You can call in advance..it'll take 1/2 hour or so.  Great to know...because I'm always at the Arboretum  I know what I'm doing this Mardi Gras.  They have big Mardi Gras celebration (duh!)..crawfish boil...possible alligator meat.  The waitress said its a busy, fu time. I can't wait.   One last thing...on our first visit..one of the daily dessert specials was a cobbler...I forget which one.  My son ordered.  It was HUGE!  Big enough for 3-4 people.  I don't like cobbler so it was left to him to try to eat after his meal.  I wish the waiter had told us that it was for sharing.  Needless to say, my son couldn't finish and he's a big 21 year old.  It came with ice cream..so couldn't take home.    After all is said and done, Cajun Yard Dog is our fav neighborhood place to eat..and will be my go to place for out of town visitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. My first Cajun Yard Dog meal in May..fried catfish with jalapeño tartar sauce, greens and potato salad.

7C2lKvcB-fSkv8AYsuHfgg.text: Don't be discouraged by a line. Small place, delicious food, worth the wait!  Calamari Okrachokie is a MUST. Fried okra, calamari, artichoke... with a delicious dipping sauce. We almost ordered a second!  You can't go wrong with their daily specials-I had the fried trout that came over the crawfish etouffee, and a side of collards. My boyfriend ordered Seafood Jambalaya with macaroni and cheese. Everything was excellent-and the mac and cheese is a must order!  They also have an awesome beer selection! I can't wait to go back and have their shrimp and grits!

IoMUWM1F_kX-yo-jxV29UQ.text: I love the food here. I don't know how authentic to Cajun the food is - never had True Cajun - but I've never not enjoyed my meal. The remoulade is delicious as well - perfect heat. My only complaint is that their wait times are outrageous. They need to offer reservations or move to a bigger building with more staff. No one wants to wait an hour with no other option but to just wait for their name to be called. Worth the wait, though, if you ask me.

kwwYwVoJ33QXrN1qhDePzQ.text: My dull witted friend suggested we try this place. I agreed only because my planet smashingly hot girlfriend agreed with him for some reason. Usually we know better than to go along with his harebrained schemes. Ordered apps, catfish bites, fried green tomatoes. Both pretty unremarkable. I don't know when the last time the kitchen changed their frying oil, but  by the taste of it probably about 14 years ago. Green tomatoes were weak at best. Ordered the jambalaya and it was a mushy practically tasteless mess. Dumb friend didn't much enjoy his meal, but he's dumb so I don't lend much weight to his dumb opinions...cause he's dumb. The eye scorching dame I call my girl ordered the fried chicken, tasted like it was fried in ash, And the topper was cold french fries!! Really? Cold french fries, Total bushleague shit CYD. Won't be back.

Svob7cbDD1Lx7fIkSzF-1Q.text: Went for dinner last night and everything sounded so good we decided to share appetizers, the mixed platter, shrimp andouille pasta and desserts! Everything tasted distinct and was made to perfection. Will definitely come here again! And the service was so friendly and helped make the evening a fun night out! Didn't realize we were the last ones out- so thanks for making us feel so much at home!

rDtq6-UJ1WLJCXulkPolOQ.text: I love cajun/N.O. styled food so once I heard about this place I had to stop in. When you walk in, there is a sign up sheet to be seated instead of a hostess which is a little odd. They weren't busy so we found a table immediately and were greeted. They have a good variety of items on the menu which is great. I went with the Jambalaya and smothered cabbage. The Jambalaya was great and tasted really fresh and homemade. I'd definitely go back for this. The smothered cabbage was different, but ok. It was like cabbage with a cheese sauce over it. The prices are a tad expensive, but they do give you quite a bit of food. The server was talkative and friendly. Apparently they also have some really good pound cake according the the table next to us. I'll be going back to get my cajun fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jambalaya &amp; smothered cabbage

1z2eKd8zEZy5HvaW_imYaQ.text: Delicious! Tried the daily catch which was grilled and seasoned to perfection and the creamy and tender smothered cabbage. The bread pudding was outstanding! I'd come back!

kT8wuUBTZ6VNHwvmYv2msw.text: Fantastic food. Great staff. If unsure what to get ask the servers. The shrimp and grits is amazing. Love this place

eeIluMs2Z8ZbddQQtTVbYQ.text: Amazing authentic, delicious Cajun food conveniently located at Arboretum. Just a hole in the wall kind of place with great foot and great service. I'm sorry I didn't try it out years sooner.

4S-97MS1lLFrmvvDMBUNPQ.text: I've eaten here many times through the years. Lately my wife & I find ourselves wanting to go once  a week or more. It seems like it only gets better! The nightly specials are hard to beat and all of their sides are amazing. The service is excellent and the staff is pleasant to deal with. I hope they are in business for many more years to come!!

A9VuLHLDTd5oVzq067zYXg.text: Cajun Yard Dog is my new favorite restaurant - I LOVE this place. Their crab cakes are delicious. My husband ordered the shrimp etoufee and said it was the best he's ever had. He loved the okra too. I ordered the fried shrimp and slaw. CYD's slaw is out of this world! My sister raved about the fried chicken, with Mac and cheese and smashed potatoes. She was even in New Orleans last month and said CYD beat all the restaurants in NOLA. The staff is super friendly too. Our server was so nice, sweet, and attentive. Lunch prices were reasonable too. My only complaint is that Cajun Yard Dog is not closer to us. Wish I had taken photos but we couldn't help but dig in to that Cajun deliciousness!

KtnblNIrld_ofI7gdJu84A.text: This tiny local haunt has been a favorite of mine for years. They're not too many Cajun alternatives South Charlotte. This place is very casual and is typically stuffed at lunch, mostly with loyal regulars. Although not a regular, I do enjoy lunch here every couple of months or so.  I normally choose the mahi, with the mashed potatoes and the collards. Everything is served with their homemade biscuits. The Shrimp Po Boys are also tasty. Service is always reliable and the restaurant consistently reflects pride of ownership.

7LUL43odPpywXGgBsbOSGw.text: Once again a great experience. Food was fantastic and service was spot on. Sunday 4pm, no one there so we sat at the bar. The blackened swordfish special was great. It came covered with pineapple slaw and a wasabi honey mustard sauce. Cooked perfectly and a good size portion. The red beans and rice were better than I expected. The catfish fingers and Mac n cheese are seem to be consistently good. We were sold on bananas foster, it did not disappoint.. We will return!

10fN5vhadienWyqhdLimLw.text: The food was amazing and our waitress was friendly. There were a few regulars and they were more than happy to share their favorites. One lady even gifted my mother and I an order of bread pudding.... which replaced my mom's entire meal. The bread pudding came with ice cream and was drizzled in a sweet bourbon sauce.   I ordered the Shrimp and Grits... the Grits were creamy and well seasoned. There were some other options that caught my eye, so I will be making my way back to this side of town.

0bBPf7K3Lh33k1q2Dkjkng.text: Excellent place to eat! I ordered the fried jumbo shrimp dinner and it was breaded to perfection! For my 2 sides I chose smothered cabbage, which I had never tried before, and green beans almondine. Both sides were fabulous! I ordered a piece of their black/blueberry cobbler to go since I was stuffed from my dinner. Our server packaged it up nice and neat and even packaged up some vanilla ice cream for me. I devoured it later that night and it was soooo good!! This place is really charming inside with its Mardi Gras decor and our server was very polite and friendly. I am so happy to have stumbled upon this restaurant and I will definitely return! Good, good food!

D3Plmh592BhSJ8-qtjSVMA.text: Cajun Yard Dog is amazing! We finally tried this place for date night. I love the feel and vibes of the dining area but I do not love having to sign my name on the wait list. We only had to wait a couple minutes and a bus boy (?) seated us at the only open table. After being seated everything was wonderful. The service was attentive and all the food was delicious. I ordered the salmon with veggies and potato salad. Everything was perfectly cooked and the portions were huge. Hubby ordered jambalaya with Mac and cheese and his food was amazing as well. I can't wait to come back!

aS1Lrovaa2eC-LyKgnQLtQ.text: The service is always great. Love their grits. Small, casual setting. Make a reservation during peak times because the wait can be long.

d3HFXw5Zf-bJrCqtOFu57g.text: So glad I FINALLY found this place. The food was great and the waitress was just as awesome. We will definitely be going back soon

Nc4Yd6pA9wTCzbnsQWTPHA.text: So I decided I would check off one of my bookmarks...Cajun Yard Dog wasn't too far from my location, so I headed over. It's located in Arboretum shops...literally next door to Michael's. The location is small, busy and loaded with aromas. My server Lynne was very friendly and enthusiastic! She talked me into a strawberry Abita (very good) and an appetizer. I have no clue how I agreed to try the deviled eggs, but that menu item was NOT "eggs-cellent"! Something's missing from the mixture. There was no flavor and they are just blah on a plate! At least they were cold...I had to chip the ice off!  I ordered the catch of the day, swai topped with a cream sauce of crawfish and shrimp. My two sides: mac-n-cheese and fried okra.  The fish was cooked perfectly! Very tender and flavorful. The cream sauce was delicious and the shellfish wasn't overcooked. The mac-n-cheese was spiraled pasta, made with a bechemel and cheddar cheese. I could taste the butter in the pasta which makes the flavor pop! The okra was fried crispy just how I like it. I even rolled a few pieces in the cream sauce.  Price wise, you're looking to spend $30 (app, drink & entree).  There's no liquor, just beer and wine. The location is small, so to avoid a wait, go at an off peak time.

RXEfg6kwOaBqzlCI5QniSw.text: Had lunch on a Tuesday with friends; we arrived just before noon and had no trouble getting a table; but, the tables filled quickly, and became quite loud. Our server was nice and checked in on us through out the meal. I had the Fried Crab Cake with the House made Macaroni and Cheese: both were tasty. It was an enjoyable experience and I will be back again.

FH-3FaHMYDvaazUmG99AYQ.text: Food was ok ..not great . As a person that eats ALOT of Cajun food from all over ..this was certainly lacking flavor ..gumbo wasn't good ..cat fish strips were good tho .. Service was fast and polite . Wouldn't go back but overall it was ok ..

MN4K1yQRvpI2RnCKAuy8Pg.text: The chicken Cordon Bleu is very good, we went for lunch and the only thing lacking was the lunch portion size of chicken... We just needed more chicken it was great the mashed potatoes were great as well!  We learned that we could order the dinner portion which we would do the next time because the chicken was great!

Dy7ZB0JmXqWp8eBnuz00dw.text: This was our first time visiting the restaurant. We were very please in our selections and was greeted with a welcoming style. The decor is definitely NOLA and my husband and I thought is made us both feel like we were in New Orleans. The food portions are huge and the beer selection was decent. Would definitely come here again.
