4F6rDV7Ruug2Qs6hXh9JTg.text: If you like Cajun food you'll love the spicy salty food they have there  The staff was attentive,  the menu prices moderate and the food choices plentiful for a small restaurant decorated with a variety of  New Orleans and Cajun glitz  We ordered the beer battered mushrooms which were  very delicious and not greasy with a tasty horseradish sauce on the side   I ordered the blackened salmon with two sides. My sides were  a cucumber salad, fresh sliced  cucumbers in a vinegar, hot sauce marinade with red onions which I  personally did not care for   The smothered cabbage with cheese was my other side,  good but the cheese made it to salty in my opinion.   The salmon was tender and delicious with the same sauce  the mushrooms came with.   My hubby's creole chicken was hot and spicy which he enjoyed.  His one side he chose was sauteed vegetables, a tender squash medley which to my surprise was very bland so I traded sides.!  Soup on the menu  but not served in the summer The restaurant offered a nice variety of sweet desserts and beverages. There is always a catch of the day, market price.  I'd go back again to try something else

zgwZtpyApQtu8U9ko67gUA.text: All the food here is amazing but the fried chicken is the best I've had anywhere in the country! Love how the staff treats everyone as family like we all eat together there all the time.

lR4uuYjalqAnUmpNC5KMgw.text: The food was wonderful! We had the Seafood Jambalaya and the Crawfish Ettouffe with the fried oysters as a starter. Oysters were a little small, but flavorful. Both the jambalaya and ettouffe were delicious! Only one thing that would prevent us from revisiting is the awful long wait. We waited about over an hour! The place is very small, so be sure not to show up hungry on a weekend night! :)

CRM5v6_dXIfZLPi-ZwXBOw.text: Amazing! Excellent service & the best fried catfish, shrimp & grits & Cajun food outside LA!! Will come back!

1ELRC4LcxmDDpVpXjFz-Kg.text: Excellent. Came here for lunch a few weeks ago with family. I had the chicken and seafood jumbalaya. Awesome. For dessert we had the sweet potato pound cake--whew! That is like a slice of heaven for a pregnant woman.   My drs.office  is right across the street and I am dissappointed they will not be open today after my appointment is over. Otherwise I would be eating cake for breakfast.

Z0x_QmyZObqh1KDUyHIJdA.text: Great Service!  Early dinner here last night... Crawfish Etoufee very good (4.5 yelp stars), Collards (4 stars), Sweet Potato Fries (5 stars Fantastic with a little vinegar on top), Anduole Sausage (3.2 stars) and for Dessert: Chocolate Pecan Pie (3.9 stars).

MIEx-ba-MxRH-rn8vakIBg.text: Was a great place to go to, but unfortunately, the food has been very inconsistent over our past 4 or 5 visits and the expertise that use to exist at the restaurant has moved on to other establishments.  May go back in a few months to see if they can fix the problems.

E3KUonT74tJYJL_yegT1nw.text: The service was really good as our server was attentive and prompt. My date was pleasantly surprised by how delicious his fried was.

dr-uslUNfZY7Oo5NAFAIiA.text: Awesome authentic NOLA food and atmosphere. I travel to that part of the country and this is as good as it gets. Portions are huge, fresh, and fairly priced. Great local and micro beer selection and tasty desserts. Does get pretty busy on weekends so just be prepared to wait... Fast bartenders make that tolerable! One time had fried green tomatoes that were out of season, but that's the only negative in 10 visits.

as0YThsoVFdHwnPE3U2nRw.text: The Cajun Yard Dog is always good for catfish, blackened salmon & etouffee. Great sides including fried okra, smothered cabbage, grits, Mac & cheese + greens. The restaurant is small so expect a wait until later in the evening. Consistently good!

xrdCnJMKz703V7ZSszP8cg.text: Awesome fries green tomatoes and shrimp and grits! The appetizers make a great lunch!

0tvE8bhq2o6_ds2EJYShNQ.text: The food was A-Mazing!  One of the best Southern meals I've had.  The fried chicken and blackberry cobbler were to die for.

0YBB30Qc6Xq5wlQkhJFELg.text: Great 1st time experience.  The staff was friendly, the food was great, and the environment was nice.  There's something on the menu for everyone and a few televisions are available for the sports fans.

IWNBaQptp8ifX2havp3sHg.text: I have been only twice, and have gotten only the fried chicken and the fried catfish (woe to my arteries). Both have been among my favorite meals in recent memory. The fried chicken was juicy and well seasoned. The catfish was expertly prepared and was almost melt-in-your-mouth. Okras were delicious. Mac and cheese was among the best I've had. Slaw was unique. I recommend this place with no reservations.

O3wdFp-yzqy1EKOpIMl8fg.text: Horrible! We waited a really long time to be seated, then waited a really long time to be served. I ordered the special skirt steak which was so overdone it was like rubber. It had no taste or seasonings at all! My husbands chicken cordon bleu was horrible as well. The roumalaude sauce was ketchup mixed with horseradish...have these people even been to New Orleans! Very expensive for quality and quantity! Will not be returning!

1LGefB_267ACiofU9VisjQ.text: This is my favorite place to eat in South Charlotte.  Great Cajun food.  My favorite is the fried oysters with cuke salad and their awesome mac 'n' cheese (their mac 'n' cheese is NOT out of a box).  Their sweet tea would make my Southern grandma proud.   To avoid crowds, for lunch I recommend arriving before 11:30 a.m. or after 1 p.m. and for dinner try to get there before 6 p.m.   CYD is not open on Sundays.

-ke2DXwyyO-p40pCpHCu9g.text: The best EVER! Myself and my entire staff eat here at least 3 times a week. The catfish, salmon, Mac n cHz, smothered cabbage EVERYTHING is amazing and friendly customer oriented staff

piAjVOtb6A9zGFZFL02_fA.text: Ate at this restaurant and had the Po Boy fried shrimp sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich lacked flavor and the sweet potato fries looked dehydrated, and tasted disgusting.  Did not live up to my expectations. Waste of money and will not be returning.

IFdmOOLhOapg8G5uUGlBew.text: Menu was very intriguing...it was my first time there didn't know what to order and I settle for fried chicken, grits, and greens. my grits s and greens were cold, was not impress...on the other hand the fried chicken was to die for...Delicious! Will definitely g go back to try some of their other menu items.

5yeSMkGAK8utZ-GdoZjJIQ.text: First off, I'm not going to enter into a debate about authenticity.  Authentic to what?  To how your mom, your grandma, his grandma, my grandma makes it?  If you travel to New Orleans (or Rome, or Paris, or Hong Kong) you will find "authentic" food prepared hundreds of different ways.    So, who cares?  Does the food taste good? That's what I care about and the food at the Cajun Yard Dog tastes good!  The restaurant is small and feels like the kind of place where after you visit a few times the wait staff gets to know you and you become a friend.  I love that.  The food (appetizer and entrees) arrived quickly, were correct and were delicious.  The waitress was friendly and kept our drinks filled.  She smiled pleasantly at our kids dropping noodles and fries on the floor.  She was a winner:)  All the items we ordered were great.  I am pretty sensitive to spicy food and my Shrimp and Grits were not spicy at all.  I realize that most expect food at Cajun establishments to be spicy.  If you like yours spicy, I am sure they will adjust the heat.  The mac n' cheese was so awesome.  I cannot imagine the calorie content, but it was stellar.  Personally, I can't wait to go back.

KMdfFO8rZC1EiP9cgwZKpQ.text: I almost don't want to write this review because I want to keep it a secret. This place is a hidden gem in south Charlotte. You cannot go wrong with anything you order but a few of the must try items are the blackened meatloaf, chicken cordon blue and gumbo. They have a great portion sizes. Unless you go really early or really late you will have to wait for a table but it is work the wait.

htLNW_GPiHtqZbcCVEbFZg.text: My husband and I have been here a few times and have yet to have a bad experience! The staff is friendly and attentive but aren't intrusive or bothersome.  Prices and portions are reasonable.  The food is delicious!  I am not a spicey food person so Cajun food is generally out of the question for me, but I have to say I really like this place! On our most recent trip I got the chicken cordon bleu with a side of mashed potatoes -- highly recommend!  My husband has tried the gumbo and etouffee and loved both.  Give the Cajun yard dog a try you won't be disappointed!

I6YzWLGLaX3fFJ8M9sBQSg.text: There are lots of other comments here in reviews that describe the Yard Dog. I've always enjoyed the food here (whether it's "authentic" or not). There for a while it was taking too long to be served to make this a lunch spot during work week. But lately, the service has been much faster. We've been able to get in and out in 45-50 minutes. I work nearby and with all of the restaurants in the area this one stays on the list. Get there early (e.g., 11:30) and you'll get a good seat. Wait much longer during the week and it will fill up. Shrimp and Grits are excellent.  I just wish they would bring back the biscuits.

AB2tFO94WapT5PXHBUdmKw.text: Authentic Cajun cuisine. Great atmosphere and great food. I went on a Monday night and watched the place fill up, I can't imagine what a Friday night looks like.

36iF9HDePJErlaGRA9oq3g.text: One of my favorite spots in all of Charlotte. Friend okra, calamari, blackened salmon, po boys, all of it. Everything is great and staff is ALWAYS friendly.

z4GXr5w6ori1lXwHm-PZjw.text: Not impressed. Went there for lunch on Saturday with the family based on a recommendation from a friend. We got the jambalaya, the blackened meatloaf, and the shrimp, all of which were disappointing. The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't good and certainly lacked the Cajun feel and spice that we were looking for. I've had better jambalaya from a frozen California Pizza Kitchen bag from the grocery store. Would not recommend!

xUYTMm0V1Vl3Muv6K4Ta8w.text: I came with a huge craving for shrimp and grits and after scouring reviews found this place! It wasn't too busy when I came in, in fact the couple waiting for their table got seated within a minute of me walking in. And then I waited. and waited. I seriously waited for about 10 minutes and wasn't even acknowledged. Where is the host/hostess? Who monitors the front???? The waitresses stayed busy not even looking in my direction so for me to flag someone down to even talk to would have been disruptive. Not one person stopped by to even tell me I could sit at the bar which I was willing to do or even to wait just a few til a table came ready...there were several seats open but I stayed right by the sign that said "Please wait to be seated".. Standing .. right there...being ignored. Well I lost all interest in shrimp and grits and whatever else this place has to sell... I don't care how good the food is, customer service has got to be a priority...

8vK-FavIwG7pCt8SJ065cw.text: Perfect joint if you're looking for a Truely SOUTHERN REDNECK HANGOUT where the regular patrons are loud, rude, and vulgar. The wait staff have grungy fingers and hair and like to chat rather than wait tables. So if you have time to spare and don't mind redneck gawking as a past time, feel free to stand around and wait while the "regulars" drink, swear, and watch tv. Why would anyone ever eat here?! BTW - Lying about the number of stars is the only way to prevent honest negative reviews from becoming buried in cyberspace.

P3WnEztAxIuGeKLK5PRsmg.text: I eat here at least once every two weeks for one dish and one dish only, a bowl of seafood gumbo! I'm from the south and have tasted some good homemade gumbo, but this is some of the best I've had in a restaurant. Huge shrimp top it all off and the seafood in it is a meal all by itself!   It's not on the menu though so ask for it by name but I guarantee you'll be as pleasantly surprised as I was. I gave it 4 stars because a friend of mine recently came with and tried the Ceasar salad, chicken gumbo side, and red beans n rice side. He said the salad was amazing but bigger than he thought and the sides just tasted ok.   I can ONLY vouch for the seafood gumbo.

64jsRxPK36m0YzwNGhld4g.text: We always have a great meal here. The husband and I went for dinner on date night. Everything we ordered was fantastic, not to mention the great service. The servers always remember us and we don't even go that frequently.  This time, the owner who has an eerie resemblance to Mark Margolis...great actor...oops, I digress. :-)  anyway, the owner was awesome and gracious. Awesome experience, as always.

TzZG5erpGv9sTnHYkeQYEw.text: Waste our money. First the house style chips came to the table burn.  That should have been I clue to leave but we decided to stick it out and hope thing would improve; boy where we wrong. The food was BAD all around. My wife is from New Orleans so we know how the food should taste.  This place doesn't rate a one star. About the only item I would give just an OK to, is the shrimp and grits.  Dine at your risk. You been warned.

XAECdeCpsLdddCuFz9OEKA.text: This place is the real deal. The Tabasco strips are unmatched. Excellent beer selection! If you can get in early on a Saturday do yourself a favor and order the chicken and waffles...if they haven't run out yet! I have yet to be disappointed with any dish in this place. My only gripe would be that there isn't a lot of seating, but this kinda adds to the whole atmosphere and gives it a touch of hometown charm. Bravo Folks! Keep doing what you do!

V-UNmbHjw1W79Jr-1bG7pA.text: I really like this place, we were in North Carolina for a couple of days and wanted to find a southern ma' and pop' kind of place and this was exactly what we were looking for. Low prices and large delicious portions. Great find for us.

TzLzmEIyZPj8onstTRw1QA.text: Had a great New Orleans theme that matched the theme of their food.  The Crab Cake po boy and shrimp n grits were great.  The place was packed and had maybe 20 tables and a bar area.  We were dissapointed only in we were looking for New Orleans food since my wife is from New Orleans.  The red beans n rice and the gumbo did not pass the test for her.  The cajun spices just were not there.  Great place for a local that just wants to have a nice dinner,  we would have to do take out in the future as there is not enough room to wait outside with a big party if we brought family from out of town.

UcTxFk9q-ycHN2AxIBr4zg.text: While on the wait list I had to use the restroom.  Thankfully I got to experience how little they care about cleanliness at this place.  The men's one person restroom had a lock on it that didn't work, a stall that you couldn't close and lock, urine and paper towels littering the toilet seat and floor, and a sink that after use would make you feel more dirty than when you started.  After returning from the restroom we walked right over to Panera Bread.  Too bad as I was looking forward to trying this place for the Cajun food, but I probably saved my wife and I from an evening of stomach pains!  After a few episodes of food poisoning over the years I've learned that if a restaurant cares that little about the customer experience (that they refuse to even fix their restroom) how could anyone believe they care about your experience with their food/drink.

-3NbvO7QhmPTLleZWMdbfg.text: Friends introduced us to the yard dog and omg, I am in love.  Amazing food, amazing service, fried green tomatoes were a hit with the hubby who never had them before...the fried catfish is absolutely perfect, beautifly flavorful, and juicy inside with a battered outside which wasn't greedy in the least bit.   The green beans almondine, were to die for.   I could deff see us becoming regulars.  Amazing, absolutely amazing.  Brought me back to time spent in nola

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes  and fried catfish ....yum yum freaking yum

3U8CX0wFlyPkYcr7Kbp_yQ.text: I wandered into this place for a lunch meeting after discovering that the Katz New York deli is closed on Monday and we did not want the "usual" Quizno's/Subway/etc. I will say that unless you know what you're looking for, there's just no way to tell from the outside what the Cajun Yard Dog serves.  At 1:00 on a weekday, the place was surprisingly busy and we were only able to find two seats at the bar, where there was a large TV tuned into a sports channel. The bartender took our drink order (a sweet tea for me and my friend went with a Red Oak draft) while we reviewed the menu.  I settled on the hamburger Po Boy, which was probably a mistake. Not that it wasn't good, but it was a burger on a baguette with mayo lettuce and tomato. I should have tried something a bit more Cajun, which was my own dang fault. I did get the sweet potato fries as my side and they were absolutely perfect - sweet and salty and plenty of 'em!  My friend asked the bartender for a recommendation and went with that - the meatloaf. He said it was very good with the two sides - mixed vegetables and mac & cheese.  The service was good and I was very pleased with the price too. Good, good food. I could see into the kitchen from the bar and it looked very clean. The only downside is that the place is very small  only  a handful of 2- and 4-top tables plus 4 or 5 seats at the bar.  Would I come here again? Absolutely!

i2o8TzplCoR5Acq0265Bsg.text: Tucked away in the Arboretum Shopping Center is a little piece of Bourbon Street, dressed with mardi gras masks, Christmas lights, and beads.  Somehow they managed to keep it classy, with intimate seating arrangements and quiet music.  Think New Orleans jazz hangout rather than Girls Gone Wild.    I love their great beer selection with a big variety of IPAs, lagers, and stouts.  I have never once eaten craw fish in my life, and I decided to brave it out and order the Black and Blue Craw fish Pasta, the special of the night.  It was a portion large enough for two meals and it was scrumptious.  I thought the blue cheese complimented the crawfish (and I was a little scared of this combination at first).    Taylor, our waiter, spoke with us about the restaurant and his love of Cajun food.  I felt very welcomed and I am a craw fish fan now as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

sZZ4FUBFcdVhMI6LG4U4aQ.text: Great cajun fried chicken but suuuuch a looooong wait. But all the food is so good here. It's hard for me because I have no patience. I have opentable and I am used to walking in and sitting down, but the food is just so darn good here I give in every time. Hmm. What do I like. Umm. Everything.  But most of all the chicken, the catfish, the fried green tomatoes, the jambalaya. The owner is also omnipresent which shows just how much the place means to her. The desserts are really great too, but you knew that.  I would tell you what time of the day I noticed it was slower, but then it wouldn't be slow at that time anymore now would it? So fend for yourselves!  Just kidding. It seems to be slow around 2pm. When I say a wait I mean 1-2hrs 5-9pm every time I've gone so if you can go at an off time and you have ants in your pants like me do so.

XGmu7RMCszLCvO3_EdJfYQ.text: Love it.  Fried Chicken, Mac/Cheese, Red Beans and Rice are wonderful.  Tough to get in.  Wish the restaurant was bigger!

sy-lzQyR_IDn7CKb-sytlA.text: The food is alright but they give so little. Had the chicken jambalaya the second time and it was a lot smaller than before. Maybe half the size as before.. we came both lunch times so portions should have been the same.

Zr2L59vHwjMLSVmbhzLTBA.text: It took us a long time to get down to this place, but I am so glad we did. The food was delicious, I can't wait to come back again.  We ventured down to south Charlotte, and found ourselves there right before the dinner rush (and yes, there was quite the rush/wait after we got in). We started with the calamari that had artichokes and okra. There was a lot more okra than I wanted, but the calamari was light, crispy and delicious. Then I ordered the shrimp etoufee for dinner with a side of beets. The etoufee was just the right amount of subtle spice, but extremely flavorful and I wanted to lick my plate clean. The beets were delicious, some of the best I've had out in Charlotte, and I wanted more of them! My husband had the fried chicken, and he was raving about the crispy skin but moist chicken inside. He nicely shared a bite with me and I couldn't agree more, it was delicious!  Cajun yard dog is definitely a place we will frequent again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken with Mac and cheese and potato salad
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamari Okrachokie
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp etoufee and beets

6gmsQEXytuDilIrwhq2Cvw.text: Came here during lunch yesterday as my friends was departing town. My friend found it and wanted to come.  The food was just okay.  Calamari had no taste at all.  The seafood jambalaya was pretty tasty.  In the end the waitress could not get our bill right.  I won't be rushing back to eat at this establishment

tzMELurQoAyqsxDKYrpjiQ.text: Forewarned: I only have 1 visit to base this review off of.  Customer service alone is 5 stars. This location really showed you southern hospitality. Made sure we had to go sweet tea (which she stated she had just brewed herself) and made some great menu recommendations too. The Shrimp and Pimento cheese grits are beyond to die for and even had me learn how to make pimento cheese to mix into my grits and I will not have them another way now. Ambiance is what you would expect of a restaurant that prepares southern/creole cuisine but it's not horrible, it actually fits in nicely and was a fun place to eat at. If I ever get to go back to Charlotte it is a location I will definitely visit again and again to get my grit fix.

3Zi6s4okxrXhw8Rw7j9yEA.text: Very good chicken Cajun style. Highly recommended . Friendly Staff and nice neighborhood  feeling.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Cajun style

0PE7qK_4VP09MJvZakEYnQ.text: How could this place get a 4...it's so awesome! 5 stars all the way. This is a quaint hidden gem with delicious authentic Cajun cuisine. I usually go to Cajun Queen because of the convenience and they also offer I standing Groupon deal but this is definitely the better of the two.  I have been here multiple times and it never disappoints. It is very small and you generally have to wait if you come here on a weekend for dinner but it is so worth the wait.   Though their specialty is Cajun food it definitely has a soul food flair. I could honestly just come here and just eat sides. They have the best cabbage I've ever had in my life and their Fried Chicken is to die for.  Tonight I opted for the special because it looked way too good to pass up and it came with two sides. It was a blackened sea bass top with blackened shrimp and a sea crab sauce. Whatever you're thinking it tasted 10 times better.  If I had to find one fault it would be that they do not have a full bar however they do have beer and wine and they have some great local beer from New Orleans. Get the Dixie Voodoo. Trust me you won't be disappointed!

F7quEuCDY_kliYqHC2aPCA.text: My boyfriend and I were first timers! We visited with a family member that recommended this place. When we first walked in there were a few parties in front of us, but we were all sat very promptly. The restaurant was packed as expected on a Saturday evening. Our waiter was the owner of the restaurant and he was super busy with greeting and sitting people, handling other tables, running food, and to go orders. He was very polite and super friendly. My boyfriend did have to get up and get his own straw after it was forgotten a few times. Other than that, our experience was awesome. I tried the fried chicken from his recommendation and another yelp review. IT WAS AMAZING! Probably the best fried chicken I've ever had! Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken (all white meat), red beans and rice, and fried okra

IP32nUA3NKZ3ArancN6L3A.text: My 1st time here and very impressed with service, atmosphere and food!  I had the chicken and seafood jambalaya which was perfectly seasoned for my taste.....  A nice paprika flavor.  The lunch portion had much more fish and chicken then there was rice (What a concept ) I even had some to take home but, honestly, I nearly couldn't stop eating it! The decor is welcoming plus there's a friendly, helpful staff. We looked to see if we could tilt the blinds & an employee came over w.out asking first. Our server was kind, very attentive and knowledgeable.  I saw they had a bar where to sit, also. Will definitely be back! An owner operated & not a big chain, ta boot!

0hUsDyrmmtx92sx5DBPpNA.text: Currently sitting in Cajun Yard Dog, I just demolished my seafood jambalaya. It was incredible as always. We are up visiting family and there was no question where we were headed to dinner tonight.  Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Jambalaya!!! It&#39;s amazing!

GswS6RFXxWPR_O4n9Zjtug.text: When I think of Cajun, being from the Deep South I think of spice/heat. I won't be coming back here unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeño deviled eggs
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits with collards

o8lyN0sKS3MABJJWiy_rZw.text: This place is outstanding. I don't know why I haven't been here before. It's a lot smaller than I thought and can fill up fast. Started with the calamari, totally different then I have ever had before. It come with fried okra and artichoke. I then had the mix platter with fried oysters, fresh and cooked perfectly, and fried shrimp, cook perfect, and BBQ shrimp. Never had BBQ shrimp before so I don't have anything to compare it to but I will be ordering it again but as a full dinner. And if your not real hungry the BBQ appetizer is big enough to be a meal and it's served with grits. Well worth the Arboretum traffic.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

3hwAR-_8tywZZ8DTN2vIAQ.text: This place is always amazing. They are always packed so be sure not to come too hungry. The place is pretty small. However, the food is worth the wait. Today I had the fried shrimp and bbq shrimp. It was really good. The cabbage is to die for!  If you are looking for a nice quiet place to have dinner, this is not it. However, if you are looking for good New Orleans food with a loud and fun environment, this is the place. The restaurant is very unique, and the staff are always really friendly.  Also, if you are looking for mixed drinks and a full bar, this is not the place, but if you are looking for really cool beer that you can't find anywhere else and an assortment of wine, this is your place. I absolutely love coming here.

jVrSbb1lhl0zCUGNgUNjNw.text: (This was delivered via Door Dash) Fried oysters were excellent.  The fried catfish tenders were also excellent and the tartar sauce with a hint of jalepeno absolutely fabulous. Both were tender on the inside and crispy on the outside. Red beans and rice as well as the side of jambalaya were very good. (both cost extra) The reason we did not give them 5 stars:    We ordered the Jumbo Fried Shrimp for 10.75 and only received 5 shrimp which were good but normally you get 1/2 dozen and this needs to be NOTED ON THE MENU.  The french fries went into the TRASH immediately.  They were limp (not from steam) with GREASE-you could squeeze the grease out of one.  Oil was not hot enough when fried.  They should know better. Neither of us cared for their red sauce.

Glu-814Hr9n2b33uoUPabg.text: We enjoy the food here, can't go wrong the service is friendly and the food is tasty, all the Cajun flavors are delicious. The only thing I wish they would expand to a a larger location. We will back :)

mEnJV9wjjOGkPKtLaEh5Ow.text: I can make this short, CYD is in my opinion the best Cajun restaurant in town. I've been there many times, tried almost everything on the menu... and it's all good. The side dishes are great, especially the mac & cheese and fried okra. The bread pudding is fantastic, just make sure they put enough bourbon sauce on it... I keep getting drawn in by the fried oysters. They are consistently fat and juicy, they have a very light cornmeal-based crust for a nice crunch, and whoever is working the fryer, is a genius. Those oysters just come out perfect every time. (Oh, definitely get the jalapeno tartar sauce.) It's not a huge place, which helps give a little bit of a cozy neighborhood hangout feel, if you live in a neighborhood where a Mardi Gras has recently exploded. It's a fun vibe. The service is good, the staff is friendly, and I've never had a bad meal there. Get thee to the Cajun Yard Dog!

r17z9fGhq-38SDgNAX2BGA.text: My ultimate spot for Cajun food.  I always tell coworkers, friends, and family about this place.  My favorite meal is the Seafood and Chicken Jambalaya with mac n cheese as one of the sides and mash potatoes.  I recommend that for any first timer.  I've eaten here on my birthday at lunch time.  It's usually always packed in the evenings.  My new favorite is the fried chicken.  The chocolate pecan pie is divine!  I didn't care much for the blackberry cobbler nor the smothered cabbage (not my taste).  The food is usually consistently good but had times recently where I got the catfish for the first time but no sauce was in my bag for it, bland almondine string beans, and bland mash potatoes in that particular order.  Other than that I still like this place a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 Fried chicken, string beans, mash, side of Mac - very fulfilling - they didn&#39;t ring up my tea order though!...and I tipped
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate pecan pie al a mode
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; seafood jambalaya with grits &amp; side of mac

54vSvHhQOk_hpWWZbJfWxw.text: Was not impressed with the food, dry and burnt. The service was great, clean bathrooms but the hallway to the bathroom was very slippery.

snzMP_nP_idqXYxh5Fmy2Q.text: My first and last time at this local hangout. Food was just OK. We ordered carry-out and they forgot  the side of green beans. We called and they said if we drove back they would give us a generous helping to make up for it.  We drove back, picked up the side and got home. It was about 14 skinny beans sadly clinging to the side of a greasy box.  See picture. We called back and asked why? The man who answered put the manager on--it was actually the woman we ordered from. She said they've didn't give us more because we hadn't ordered green beans in the first place. What? Then why tell us to drive back for some?  She was rude, condescending and argumentative. She wouldn't let me finish a sentence and she was yelling at me. People in the room that heard us place the order could hear her yelling through the phone. We had ordered green beans--had to tell her twice when ordering. Regardless, it seems the customer is always wrong at the Cajun Yard Dog, and the staff gets away with rudeness. In any event, food not worth the hassle or the price--we spent $60 for an appetizer, a small salad and two entrees. Probably the lousiest meal and service ever for even half the price. We recommend Cajun Queen over this bar food (rubbery chicken and crawfish) and  obnoxious service any day!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Full&#34; order of green beans that they forgot and we drove all the way back for.

C3xo76bm2bCh23-2hfeDVw.text: Cajun in Charlotte... I've been to Cajun restaurants throughout Louisiana (New Orleans, Baton Rouge, Lafayette, etc) and some in Atlanta so when I moved to Charlotte I had to find one here too. Walking in the door there's a small dining room (20 tables maybe); menu is what's expected: red beans and rice, seafood gumbo, po-boys.  So I ordered seafood gumbo to start (this is a meal of its own) and fried catfish w/ Mac&Ch and creamy grits (no carb diet for me) so let's get into this.  Seafood gumbo was just ok; roux was (too) thick with 2 large shrimp, chunks of chicken, andouille sausage, 5 mussels and handful of crawfish tails but I was missing my veggies (okra, celery, bell peppers, onions... anything).  Catfish meal was also just ok; nice crust on the fish, 4 strips is equivalent to 2 medium filets so portion was decent. Mac&Ch isn't worth writing about. And grits were creamy and that's my only comment.  Will I return... probably with my family when the visit and I'll try something else but I wouldn't go out of the way to run back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

gc5X6j-pSA1p8lMbhItPSw.text: The hostess station is weird. I wouldn't even call it a station. It's a legal pad and your write your name and party number.   I ordered the shrimp and andouille pasta. It was creamy and amazing. Our waiter was friendly and hospitable. I have a long list of dishes that I'd like to try.   They receive pound cakes on Tuesday from a local bakery and the cakes are usually sold out by Friday. I've heard great things about the pound cake & can't wait to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; andouille pasta

OrgDOT6G6550Nz_d4VixIA.text: I ordered shrimp etoufee, fried shrimp and tobasco chicken. The shrimp etoufee definitely was reheated. It tasted like it had been in a plastic container. Disgusting. The sides didn't look fresh(veggies and smothered cabbage). The Mac and cheese was literally just noodles and cheese. The only thing that was really good wAs the tobasco chicken. The picture actually makes it look better.

SynyvhcnaNsqHrN0M79Taw.text: Excellent food. We tried deviled eggs, Tobasco chicken, potato salad, coleslaw, jambalaya, grits. Shrimps were a little oily. The lemon pound cake was to die for!! On the whole a most satisfying meal for my kids & parents.

qmrncjUBa-EihKbsTX0L0A.text: We've eaten here a number of times for lunch & have always enjoyed our meals. The shrimp & grits are excellent, as is the shrimp po' boy.

92_odneGIUg5EO4p4ANIEQ.text: We LOVE the Cajun Yard Dog!!   My Gumbo cravings keep me coming back!  My 12-year-old loves the Tobasco Strips with Mac and Cheese.  He also has to check out the desert menu which has fresh surprises every week.  He enjoyed the sweet potato spice caramel pound cake this week.  On a scale of 1 to 10 he gave it 100!  I feel the same about the Bananas Foster!

FOBYZZBsWsTnn4gu1prCcg.text: I have a love hate relationship with this place.  My belly likes it but my abs hide from it.  If you love savory or salty food this is the place for you.  I happen to love savory but some of the dishes here were a bit too salty for me, like the catfish. And the collard greens.  The fried chicken is well seasoned and tasty but very tangy so if you are not into vinegar marinades this fried chicken is not for you.  I like it.  The fried okra is delicious and salty... Maybe a little too salty but I think we all new what we were getting into going in.  I mostly do take out here because it's very close to home and the service isn't phenomenal.  The servers always seem overworked or like they have another pressing matter to attend to that just doesn't happen to be the diners.  What I love most about this place is for about 30-35 bucks I can get a quality bucket of 16 pieces of chicken and two sides and for a busy mom with a party of 5 and boys who play lots of week night sports, this saves me time and sanity which I'm sure some of you can appreciate.

QCsZTLfHBI6YitPBIsNJnw.text: The shrimp and grits was some of the best I have had! The service was really slow , I sat at the bar on my 1 hr lunch break and got over looked for several min and they were not even busy..but once I did get serviced it was great and I would definitely give them another try!

I4-zYTxukF0tW4074PSJOQ.text: I went to CYD for the first time last night with a friend. As I am a vegetarian, this may have not been my first choice, but I'm always up for trying new places and my rating is a balance of my experience. Five stars for the fried okra and chocolate pecan pie, 2 stars for the deviled eggs  and 1 star for the iceberg tomato salad. I wanted the Cesar salad, but they were out of romaine lettuce. The place is small and we waited at least 40 minutes for a table, but there's a lot of shops in the strip mall to pass the time. Our server was courteous and efficient. If I go back, I'll get the fried okra again and try a few more sides.

GkpFcLspQ26tlGuDXXUMiw.text: Food was fantastic.  Service was good.  Wait for table was bearable.  Bar selection was okay.  We liked the small atmosphere with eclectic decor.  We will be back.  What we ate:   Calamari Okrachokie - delicious artichoke and okra, pretty good calamari.   Shrimp & Grits - Over-the-Top Delicious.  Makes my mouth water to type. Blackened Mahi with pickled beets and green beans - very good fish, really liked the beets, green beans were good but nothing too special. BBQ Shrimp with Jambalaya and sweet potato fries - BBQ shrimp and jambalaya were great, SP fries just okay. Bread pudding - huge portion of incredible dessert - melt in your mouth delicious.

5g1qa2Jw3LxYJzNDSfnCdw.text: I heard very good reviews on this place but was not thrilled.  First, the service was poor.  I don't know if there weren't enough servers, but it took a while to be served.  I had the Cordon Bleu, which I love, so was hoping the reviews were correct.  I ordered a beer as well.  Not the best selection but manageable.  Anyway, as soon I saw the ham and cheese on top of the chicken, I was skeptical.  Yup, not the way to prepare this dish.  It was a little dry.  It wasn't horrible but I was expecting a lot more. The mashed potatoes were just okay as well.  The waiter never asked if I wanted another beer and my wife had to hunt another staff member down to get water.  I may try it again if friends wanted to go, otherwise, I don't think so.

waTRoLrN0fpE-MRfIZsBmw.text: Ordered the catfish sandwich that was recommended by the waitress and the bread was too thick, the sandwich was dry, The fries were oily as hell and little they look like they were fries remains. What I ever go back? No. The atmosphere was nice but I wouldn't go back...my first time and it wasn't a great experience.

F6VzeYjyf3ZMYyXweisI9Q.text: My very first visit to Cajun Yard Dog occurred soon after I returned to Charlotte, NC after a year in Miami, FL in 2005/2006. The eclectic decor was charming, definitely a conversation starter, like a visual story that got my imagination running.  On my first visit (pre-dinner), there was NO WAIT!!!  I sat at the bar even though there were available tables back in the day - the staff swears there are "No Wait" times that happen throughout the day currently, but I've never seen it myself :)  I had a glass of wine & the etouffee; I was hooked!!  I've NEVER had a bad meal there, not one single time!  As a matter of fact, the food is ALWAYS INCREDIBLE!!  Cooked and prepared to perfection consistently and with fresh ingredients - this applies to everything I've personally tried on the menu (to include specials on the board); appetizers, fish, sides & DESSERTS!!!  Anything fish at Cajun Yard Dog is my favorite...fried, blackened or grilled.  To date I haven't had a bad fish experience there & honestly I think that speaks volumes!!  On our most recent (but definitely not last) visit there about a week ago, I had the catfish bites, my partner had the trout and our guest (out of town from Ohio) had the redfish - ALL THREE DISHES WERE SCRUMPTIOUS!!!  We split a HEALTHY sized portion of Peach Cobbler that was "right out of the oven" and it was mouth wateringly divine!!!  Mind you, I haven't tried EVERYTHING on the menu, but I've probably come close after patronizing this restaurant for 9 years.   For me and my partner, we choose to return to a restaurant because the food is amazing, but I must say the gang at Cajun Yard Dog is FANTASTIC, too and you'll want to come back to visit with them just as much as coming back for a delicious meal!!  Chances are you might find yourself soon conversing about kids going off to college with the wait staff after a few visits!!  I've read a few reviews here today about Cajun Yard Dog and frankly was a tad bit surprised about how some people make it personal; one claiming it was a redneck hangout, a few reviewers felt the need to point out the staffs hair (something along the lines of not being perfectly in place), fingers or they way the staff appears as if they want to be somewhere else.  I've worked in the food service industry - it's a demanding job and all I have to say about that is "THANK YOU STAFF" for working your butts off and making this NON-CHAIN, NONCONFORMING little slice of yummy paradise a gem!!!  I don't give a damn if your hair isn't perfect and though you didn't expect to have to work 4 or more doubles/split shifts in a row...you did anyway and not only did you do it, but you were AWESOME while doing it!!!  Hell, I KNOW I secretly daydream of being off in a place far, far away from reality at times - sometimes I even dared to daydream while I was at WORK (especially if I'm having a crap week).  I think it's pretty hilarious, too, that a restaurant would be judged / rated on whether or not they serve alcohol; I go to a restaurant to eat, not to have a "Hurricane" frou-frou drink.   Cajun Yard Dog is UNIQUE and is NOT your typical pretentious / "Charlotte-Stepford Style" / let's keep up with Jones' / where to be seen local "hot spot for the minute" kind of place - THANK GOODNESS!!!  Cajun Yard Dog has substance, heart & soul - the quality of the food and the staff sees to that.  Guess that's why they've been around a while!!  Already dreaming of our next visit :)

UInoyX7b_NmbbRqoiaRGoA.text: The blackened meatloaf was very tough and rubbery. My friend ordered oysters (or clams) and was pleased. I've eaten here only about 5 times and the other meals I have had were good. Stay away from the meatloaf though.

KDW4ySsVExXfv6xI4uOvhQ.text: Food is well seasoned and you won't go home hungry. Overall a good experience. I will be back.

hIUOIvu5C-ZRS4as0kIfqg.text: Finally made it in to Cajun Yard Dog! This place can be a bit tricky with getting a table! Quaint inside, popular for sports fans and great food can pack out the inside in no time flat. My wife and I ventured in for an early-ish dinner on a Saturday night.   The menu houses a phantasmagorical array of Cajun choices. Etouffe, jambalaya, seafood....all choices apropos for the bayou-seeking culinaries.   First, we ordered a few drinks and an app. Great beer choices. Red Oak from outside of Greeensboro, and Abita root beer. If you haven't had Abita's root beer, you must. It's incredibly flavorful and not overtly laden with sassafras. The house-made chips are wondrously prepared. A little more done than most, served with herb sour cream and a BBQ cream. The BBQ cream is faint and sweet and the herb is much more pungent.  My wife ordered a menagerie of side items. Veggies, Mac n' cheese, fried okra and jalapeno cheese grits...oh, those grits. They are incredibly creamy and packed with flavor(s). All were fantastic.   I had the chicken jambalaya. A HEAPING plate of jambalaya packed with chicken, smoked summer sausage, rice, spices and a brilliant sauce. Each bite is packed with that roux-y, tomatoe-y, spicy sauce and the chicken/sausage chunks in each bite are subtle and plentiful. The level of spice is manageable for anyone, in my opinion. Not over the top but definitely enough for you to recognize throughout the meal. There was so much of it, I had to take most of it home!    Prices are fair and the service was great. Next time, have to try the desserts!  So happy with this quaint, festooned with Mardi Gras accoutrement, Cajun joint! Can't wait to go back!

oaibEnP1dxp9vWBUgdLdPA.text: This place was good; the calamari and okra appetizer was great, excellent meatloaf, the BBQ Shrimp were good, and the pecan pie was GREAT! I don't know how authentically cajun this place is, but they serve comfort food, and I left comforted!   This is a great place to split an appetizer, main dish, and dessert between two people...plenty of food.  Good value!

AhWWbUl0BhbG1hUnXw6X4w.text: The Yard Dog has style, their own style, that is. It's campy and fun to go there. I like their menu (my husband is crazy about their cajun meat loaf) and they have a calamari appetizer that is amazing.   I highly recommend their fish entrees if you like fish (steamed or fried or, of course, cajun!) Not particularly impressed with their red beans and rice, but their etouffee and gumbo are excellent. I love their side dishes, which includes mac n cheese, fried okra, cucumber salad, green beans and much more.   The Yard Dog always has fun beer options and a great dessert menu, as well as an easy kids menu that will please the picky little eaters in your family.

gxcchhmV5YLV5ohwT5ynrQ.text: Consistently good food.  I really like the fried chicken. The restaurant is TINY so if there are diners waiting then you may wait for a while.

zprlUlBSrOgNySUkIcJd1Q.text: We have been here several times since moving to Charlotte.  Not being a Southern boy myself, I can't attest to the authenticity of the recipes, but the food is just straight up good.  My wife always goes with the shrimp and grits, while I might go with a blackened fish of the day or the fried chicken.  And don't forget the rice and beans as a side.

oASdAX6yvn8hSy60brccfQ.text: We had dinner here for the first time last night -- and it won't be the last. The fried mushroom starter was delicious -- prepared very well and not greasy. We followed that with the chicken cordon bleu. The chicken was crispy and the sauce was a creamy wonderful surprise. The portion was very generous. We followed with a fabulous blackberry cobbler served with ice cream and whipped cream. From start to finish, the meal was delicious, the service attentive, and the owner went the extra mile to ensure that we were enjoying our meal.

ssPAOlOF6eFXapuoDj77Ug.text: Excellent food and service.  Ask for Jenna to be your server, she's awesome.  I have had the blackened Mahi and Wahoo, both excellent.  My wife gets the jambalaya, which has just enough spice and the seafood in it is delicious.  However, the highlight is the fried okra?!!!    You must go here and discover this gem in the arboretum...

G6ryL8KpcJsipda1vkaGCQ.text: This place is a True hole in the wall but an amazing find! It's super small and you'll def have to wait for a table but that's about the only complaint. I had the shrimp and grits and it was amazing! The grits were perfectly cooked and not overly cheesy, the shrimp were good size and flavorful it had just the right amount of spice. I had the Mac and cheese as my side, its home made creamy and delicious. My boyfriend had the fried catfish which was the best I've ever had. It was super crispy, the breading stayed on and not greasy at all. The only subpar thing was the chips appetizer we ordered, they weren't hot and probably been fried a while ago and the dipping sauces were pretty bland. Over all it's authentic cajun/creole and worth a try, you won't be disappointed.

C8D-uCieQDoRDY_Y5nDu0w.text: For someone that likes Cajun style food but without the seafood part, it was a bit odd for me to come. However, I have passed by this place numerous times, I figured I'd give this place a try.   I came during lunch time. There wasn't a lot of people in the restaurant, but within 10-15 minutes, it got pretty busy.   I ordered the blackened meatloaf with the smashed potatoes and green beans with almonds. The meatloaf was topped with a tomato sauce with some tomato chunks, onions and topped with green onions. The meatloaf had a slight kick to it which was nice. The potatoes were good and green beans also tasted great.   The price of it was very reasonable for lunch. I didn't feel like the service was bad. My sever did stay pretty busy, but there was another lady walking around, filling drinks and cleaning up tables so that was nice.  Can't wait to try something else next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Meatloaf, Smashed Potatoes, Green Beans

4I2EICGrmIhiMdu2rwwDqQ.text: This has been the closest we have come to authentic New Orleans style Cajun food. I got smothered cabbage which is definitely a treat I think you can only get here! Our Friends brought here and they were about to close, but they still served us and treated us like family. Food was fresh and delicious. Thank you and we will be back again!

CvVTfxVBVX3C7-cP1BsrEQ.text: Review update: what is up with this place?? I decided to give I another chance because my mom wanted the fried chicken, which she actually did enjoy. The salmon that I had was also good. It's the service that's killing it all.   The side salad are awful. They up-charge $3, even if you opt out of getting any other sides at all. It's basically a big huge plate of lettuce only. A pale tomato and 2 cucumber slices on the side. You get a tiny dressing and $.50 for any extra. Rip off. The lettuce was gross. Bitter and just too much.   We waited so long for our food. After it was delivered, the waiter never came back. It was pretty bad. We had to hunt him down to get boxes and a check. The busboy had to help us with refills and food that the waiter forgot to bring out. The busboy was nice.  I won't be coming back. I've learned my lesson with this place.

Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackberry cobbler
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened tuna, fried shrimp, cucumber salad, &amp; smothered cabbage

Zxi-h9V8_As0FeRXNsjeXQ.text: Tried this restaurant based on the reviews I read here on yelp. Had the fish po'boy and fish chips as an appetizer. The sandwich was a bit on the dry side so I'd recommend asking for additional condiments on the side. The prices were reasonable and fair enough that I'll give it a second visit. 3 stars as there wasn't anything overly memorable about the decor, food or atmosphere

8Tie32sAg3UI7fiJ1cW-ew.text: The seafood etoufee is the way to go here. Fresh, smokey, and really filling. Rice properly cooked and not mushy.  Pick the creole dishes and avoid the deep fried aisle.

v2O7qUE-3RzQjczPnj3Mbg.text: Don't think there's really anything that I don't like about CYD. I've been loving this place for years but always seem to forget about coming here unless I'm riding down 51 or actually in the Arboretum. But today was the perfect Saturday to remember. The ambiance in here is so beautiful and reminiscent of New Orleans. If you've never been to N.O you'll definitely get a feel of it here. The staff is super chill and inviting, always checking your table to make sure your good. The food comes out fast, hot and good!!! I had the catfish platter that comes with two sides and everything was perfect. The collards are freshly made and my sweet potato fries hit the spot. I know that there are other locations but I'm gonna stick to what I know. They haven't steered me wrong yet

0re0tB5ryLjR-hunXSqPCA.text: Always a good time here with great food. Confused about the service I had. But the food was on point. Yes will return but might check out the other location too.

pr1skmC_8OH3_kiRIs4YJw.text: Service is slow but that is forgiven once the food finally arrives. Absolutely delectable!

MO8kCE-KSTebzOfiPZD83w.text: I came here just to get an appetizer after an appointment. I decided on the crab cake. It was really good. I love the flavor. I must say that it was a little crunchier than I'm used to but it still had so much flavor. This is my first time here. I am definitely going to come back when I have a little more time on my hands.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Crab Cake

_nRK4kPC94MyWGD-KGqzrw.text: Had a great meal last night at CYD.  The staff is always friendly and know the menu.  The special was blackened haddock with Cajun shrimp and sauce.  It was awesome.  The haddock was a thick piece.  I love the side offerings at CYD, had the pickled beets and coke slaw last night.

6O_PXDyWyVzpBXDv2stt2g.text: Crab cakes will bring me back. Cheap drafts will bring me back. The fact that the food is overpriced will make me a more of an infrequent guest than I wish I could be.

wsyFi2orf6mFFKYuSLNc3A.text: We went for dinner. Purposely came early at 5:30 since we know it is always packed. Even on Sunday evening. This place is a local fave.  So here is the dish run down: Side order: Smothered Cabbage - is definitely a MUST!; Sweet Potato Fries - ok; Fried okra - ok; Mac n Cheese - good. Entree: I ordered the Trio (Fried Oyster - good; Crab cake - Excellent!; Blackened Mahi - a bit too dry). Salmon Poboy - ok; Meatloaf - Excellent!! Dessert: Blackberry Cobbler - it's OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!!!!! And the people there are super friendly, especially our server.

uGqgmkuLl1nzqQHlcRYnCA.text: I had a great time here. Hidden away in the Arboretum is this Cajun gem. Despite a full restaurant we had attentive friendly service from Todd. He kept our drinks full and our food was excellent and quick. I had the rice beans and sausage meal which was wonderful and as a side I took the recommendation of cabbage. Not my normal but it was surprisingly good, crunchy in a Swiss cheese sauce that really worked. I will definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States

PTns_w_O25DAS43xnYJ_8Q.text: I have yet to have a bad meal here. The special and the catch of the day are always a good choice. The jambalaya is also excellent. The catfish plate is not for the faint of heart or the light eater. The smothered cabbage sounds absolutely horrible but it's the best side they have and they have some really great sides.

A8v2wnZmn2k1mn9dcQThtA.text: We just love, love, love Cajun Yard Dog. You can't go wrong with the fried catfish. The  jalapeno tarter sauce they serve with it is the best. And honestly, you can eat that sauce with about any other meat. I often eat it with the fried chicken. For lunch, I had smothered cabbage with my fish. So, so good!  It's like a ma & cheese sauce meets cabbage.  Today we got here around 2pm for lunch. During peak times there could be a wait of an hour or so. But it's worth it! The wife also likes their bread pudding. It's a very huge portion and comes with a very nice caramel sauce. I'd suggest getting a scoop of ice cream to go with it.

z-3jM61ww4mkOtMoUcbeHg.text: I ordered the Red Beans and Rice which was pretty decent and flavorful although not very spicy. My friend got the chicken soup and liked it. The server was very nice and made sure we were happy with the food. Service seems to be a bit slow but worth the wait. My reasoning for giving Cajun Yard Dog a three star rating is their on-line menu. A platter of fish was $9.75 but when we went to the restaurant, the price was $13 and some change. That's quite a difference and management should really keep their website up to date.

3SeuMG8DumcpTISoSPN-3Q.text: The seafood jambalaya and Mac & cheese is good. My friend had blackened red snapper which I taste and it was good. The place is cozy and tucked away. My waitress was nice and did a wonderful job. This was our 1st time here and had a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun yard dog

oNzSAch5uvJJ1a8yvQZq9Q.text: So sad to report that this place went downhill...WAY down...since my last visit a few months ago. WTF happened?!? Last time, the food was so AMAZING...and this time, just AWFUL! I tried their Crawfish Etouffee this time, along with a side of Gumbo Soup...and both were so incredibly bland and blah!! I actually had to pour some salt into both dishes, and still, utterly tasteless! Did they have some substitute chef back there today, or what? I just can't understand how one dish can be soooo damn good (Jambalaya from my last visit), and yet, another dish be soooo damn bad?? Maybe it's just me...but for Etouffee, I prefer the sauce to be on the thinner side...more soupy. Here, at least for today, the sauce was super-thick and pasty...and even worse, there was barely any flavor to it. Add to that, it just tasted stale...NOT fresh at all. Possibly the worst Etouffee I've ever had in my life!  Gumbo Soup was the same - NO flavor. Even their Iced Tea - ZERO flavor. Did the chef just pour extra water into everything?!? Honestly, I was embarrassed. Why? I actually recommended this place to several folks. Even for this lunch gathering here with several friends today, I vouched for how good the food was! From the mild reactions to their dishes, I sensed that everyone was underwhelmed. One positive outcome from my visit here? I managed not to gain any weight...as I barely ate half the portion of my soup AND entree.  Yes, shockingly enough, I did NOT finish off my plates!!! Overall, it was a shocker for me....going from a 5-star to a 1-star dining experience. :\

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crawfish Etouffee

sb1D3ImzTV2rzl991zwMbA.text: I went here today for a quick lunch. You walk in and the place is filled with New Orleans themed decorations. The place was packed and it was a seat yourself type establishment. I was by myself so I saw a table in the corner so I sat at that table, I asked the waiter if she could wipe it down it took her awhile but she finally did. I ordered the jambalaya and the deviled eggs as my appetizer, it took about 15 for the waiter to take my order, which I thought was pretty long. My jambalaya came out before my deviled eggs which made it pointless for me even getting it as an appetizer. The jambalaya and the Mac and cheese was pretty good and flavorful, the deviled eggs were just okay. As I was eating I noticed that I had no silverware nor napkins only a fork that she had brought out inside of a bowl. I didn't get a refill on my water until I was about to leave which was quite irritating..the food was good but the service sucked! I may give it another try though.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeño deviled eggs
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and seafood jambalaya

YUGywWXyzneiAs6G-OLFAg.text: I visited Cajun Yard Dog for lunch on a weekday where I happened to be in a part of the QC that I don't frequent often.  I looked at my Yelp bookmarks and there was the Dog right around the corner.  Wound up sitting at the bar, was immediately greeted, given a menu and a glass of water to help cool off on a hot day.  I wound up ordering a combo of fried catfish and shrimp with a side of fries and a side salad which they brought out first.  Salad was fresh and crisp with decent blue cheese dressing and the catfish/shrimp came out hot but not overcooked and came with lemon and some tasty tartar sauce.  The woman serving at the bar was very friendly and when all was said and done I was in and out quickly and left full and happy.  Just what most folks are looking for out of a workday lunch.    If I lived closer to the Arboretum I would absolutely have Cajun Yard Dog on the regular rotation.  Seems like a fine place with good food, good service and a nice vibe.

DIHfQ_2_yd3pDBHedh8png.text: This place was packed on Saturday night, so I was really expecting to have my socks knocked off, especially considering the reviews on here. The place is small, so expect a wait if you go during peak times. The food was ok, but not spectacular.  Waitstaff was nice and friendly.  I had the fried flounder special over fried green tomatoes with a bleu cheese slaw.  The fish was ok, but under seasoned, and the fried batter just fell right off and was a bit soggy and not as crispy as I would expect.  The fried green tomatoes were the best thing on my plate, they were very good.  The slaw was alright, but not very strongly seasoned or flavorful.  We had some gumbo, which was ok, but again underseasoned, and had lots of rice and not much meat or veggies.  Someone else ordered the blackened trout, which was ok, but still, underseasoned.  Blackened should be very spicy, but it wasn't at all.  The mac and cheese was ok, but with that runny cheese sauce like out of a box, not stringy like there was actual melted cheese in it.  Collards were ok, nothing to brag about.  The best thing we had was the Jambalaya, which was still skimpy on meat and mostly just rice.  It was seasoned very well though and had a little bit of heat.  Overall it was an OK meal, but I've had a lot better.  When I end up dousing everything in hot sauce its clearly not a great meal.

2NbCKl331BTiWYrlUT-HUw.text: Delish!!! Eat here when I am at the Arboretum. If you like Cajun food you will love it

nVWH7NyyWYct8XVQTx9j9g.text: After trying Cajun Yard Dog for the first time yesterday I am even more convinced that I don't love Cajun food. I think I have tried every Cajun food place in Charlotte and each time I leave dissatisfied. Yesterday was no different. I was certainly underwhelmed by the food.   The atmosphere was cozy and a little over the top tacky but in an entertaining way. My guest and I sat at a corner table. No one puts Baby in a corner! Sorry I just had a Dirty Dancing flashback.  I was fine sitting in the corner.   We were greeted immediately which was nice and the waitress was more than happy to give us the rundown of the menu and her personal favorites. She did not like the Etoufee. Oh that's not a good sign. My intention was to order the Etoufee. Now what?  I had the Fried Oysters and I will say this, they were probably the BEST Fried Oysters I ever had! The coating was DELISH! Light, crispy and non greasy. I could have pigged out on the oysters alone and would have left very happy. The only problem was there were only 6. I personally would have liked a few extra on the plate. The big disappointment came with the sides. Fried Okra (hello, one of my favorite veggies!) and Red Beans and Rice. Doesn't get anymore Cajun then that. The Okra was over fried and VERY GREASY. Yuck! The Red Beans and Rice was equally disappointing. It was very bland and they were luke warm.    For what we got I felt the price was high especially for lunch. 6 oysters, Red beans and rice, Fired Okra and a club soda, $15.80 before tip.  A little steep IMO. Throw a dozen oysters on the plate and then I will gladly pay the $$.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Oysters, Okra and Red Beans and Rice

pGRL-AlJzmgCVvJO3jYtgw.text: This place has excellent food. Definitely a gem in charlotte. HOWEVER. They must figure out a better way of making people wait. There has always been a wait each time I've gone, so I'm sure the restaurant knows they are popular and people will wait for their food. At the moment they have a sign in list at the front, on a normal legal pad, with no one monitoring it. People write in their own names and a restaurant employee comes over every once in a while to call out a name. There is limited waiting area inside and some space outside. During the winter months it is cold and most are forced to wait outside to hear their name. THey need to introduce something where they can text you when your table is ready, or have a heated area outside for people to wait. There is a nice wine bar in the same complex where we went while we waited  but we're worried we'd miss our name. We came back only to wait at least 30 minutes longer in the freezing cold because there is no heating outside. I love this restaurant, I really do, but please update your waiting area situation to make it more appealing to diners.

QSLZ7S6g9J3PSyITgDyeRw.text: This is one of the best spots in town.  The atmosphere is fun and entertaining.  The staff is friendly and the food is phenomenal! Tasty doesn't begin to describe it.   As far as price goes, you'll save a heap and not go home hungry for lunch! The gumbo is fabulous and the mac and cheese is a definite yum!

MA1SO2_nOVYYO1uNgxBY0w.text: One of the best places on South charlotte. The blackened meatloaf is awesome . The fried chicken is the best in town!

rHu6dZYi4o-rvvha2ucsrA.text: The staff was great and owners were really nice. I love Cajun food, however my food was a bit too greasy for my liking.

KH1ct__YqW01OR33nsyIVw.text: Been dying for fried chicken and tried this place on the suggestion of a friend. Ok, the way some of these people described this place made me think I was gonna walk into some kind of shithole. This place is adorable!! Small and cozy. Very Mardi gras themed, but not over the top. We went around 6:15 on Saturday and were seated right away. Waitress really nice, knowledgable, and attentive. We ordered the jalapeno deviled eggs and they came with a ton of jalapenos which weren't needs, since the eggs had a nice kick already, but needed more mayo. Obviously premade, but good. We saw other plates coming out and they looked big so we split the half fried chicken and two sides. The wait was a little long, but it's cooked fresh and it was understandable. The chicken was hot and fresh and crispy and good.! Not the best fried chicken I've ever had but very good. Spices were really nice and not over-the-top but delicious. Tasted very homemade. The potato salad was really good had some horseradish in it. I've never had fried okra but they're on the same type of flavor profile as a zucchini and they were pretty good too. Overall,  the chicken was good and I would definitely go back but I definitely want to try another chicken place that might beat this one. I think it might be Price's Chicken Coop as far as I hear.

T6p5TYdA65BHORaW1n2KoQ.text: We have been there a few times. It's one of those things that it's hard to find LA Cajun style food in this area. I find that this place is a hit and miss. The fish was under cooked this time, but it was seasoned well. The big problem that I had was that they charged for refill on sauces. Really? If it was outstanding, wouldn't mind paying those prices. So, we will keep searching for that delish Cajun seafood.

Xso977TGgZBfVADStq-hFg.text: Had lunch here with my husband and I must say the best food in Charlotte hands down. We're Caribbean so we tend to look for flavor without adding anything extra. My husband ordered shrimp & grits and the red snapper. I ordered the catfish with masked potatoes and it reminded me of grandmothers cooking. I ordered a slice of key lime pound cake and fell in love. All of my childhood memories in one spot.

IF6HJU8UhKGr-KCwfo0Tww.text: TL;DR version: Food is definitely lacking, but not inedible. Fried catfish appetizer was best. Sauces and Dressings were decent. Blackened fish was inexcusably dry and overcooked.  Banana Foster was good, although the ice cream was noticeably old even after being drenched in cognac sauce. Ambiance was lively and enjoyable. Server (Marc) was knowledgeable, timely, and friendly.  Host (possible owner?) was a total dick.  This was our first ever visit to the CYD.  It was around 7:45 on a Saturday night. We added our name to the legal pad by the door and I asked to see a menu as the host was leading a party to their table. "Absolutely" he said, as his eyes pointed towards the floor. No smile. A few minutes later he returned and crossed our name off the list, and asked if we were ready to sit.   "Actually, We'd like to see a menu before we make a decision." I said. We immediately decided the menu would be acceptable (for the teens, that's why we asked).  Another group of four entered the restaurant. The host sat them ahead of us, then had the audacity to tell me they were there before us. It wasn't a huge deal, as the next  table had just become available, which he explained.  He led us to the still dirty table, and as he was wiping he told us that we could just let him know when the 4th member of our party arrived and he would bring a 4th chair.  I wasn't down with that plan. He wanted us to sit down, but then when our 4th member (who was still in the car) walked in, you want me to get up from my seat, chase you down to ask you for a 4th chair while she just stands there? Don't think so, buddy. So I grabbed an empty chair from the table beside us and pulled it up to our table. "I have chairs over on that side." he tells me. Good. Good for you. Go get it yourself. WTAF?   Our server was prompt and polite. We enjoyed the beer selection...from the list that the host failed to provide us with. (Can you tell this dude rubbed me the wrong way? Letting it go now ;) We ordered the fried catfish app which was piping hot. There were five pieces. That fifth piece was highly coveted. I had a side salad, which was reasonably fresh. It was a spring mix with shredded carrots, tomato wedges, and sliced cucumbers. No complaints there.  Entrees: Blackened salmon w/horseradish sauce. Sauce and seasoning were satisfying. Salmon was dreadfully overcooked. Regular & Sweet potato fries were both acceptable. Mahi--same issue. Tooo dry. I had the special, which was blackened tuna over dirty rice with a crawfish basil sauce. Tuna was (can you guess? I bet you can guess.) waay overdone! The rice? Tasted like it came right out of a stainless steel 1/9 pan. Definitely not fresh. It wasn't even warm.  I liked the crawfish, though. You might be asking why we did not alert our server to our distaste, especially before writing a less than stellar internet review. That's a fair question, and as shitty as I have made it sound, we ate ALL of our food. 6 hours in the hot sun at a Rugby tournament, and you too would eat whatever was set before you in its entirety. The food wasn't THAT bad, but it was unequivocally unimpressive. Except the Banana Foster. That gets a solid thumbs up. Yum!  Another shout out to our server, Marc, who never let our drinks run dry, spaced our courses perfectly, and answered all of our questions. He cleared and reset the table between each course.  Great job, Marc!

19mhlCCrtLX10mqIL0oqvQ.text: In Charlotte for a conference and wanted to try something different outside of the hotel. Service was great, food was good. The fried chicken was definitely on point and was some of the best I ever had, even me being from L.A.!  I really was craving jambalaya, but found theirs to be too wet and too salty for my taste. Mac n cheese was pretty flavorless, greens were good.

XNA1UWtHpTLDgLWQAYrXCw.text: Always love the catfish bites!!! Sometimes that's all we order for the table. Service is not always that friendly and they have turned our group away in the past, but we'll keep going back for the catfish.

G5vdq0IiXUgdy9OLlIJzTA.text: I love this place!  I eat here several times a month and it has always been good.  The seafood gumbo, crab cakes, crawfish etouffee, cajun meatloaf, catfish and sides are great!  I have probably ate here 50 times at least.  Everything is fresh made and the service is fantastic.

2PmdWRddT1YxsALvaCwFlQ.text: Great little hole in the wall place. the seating area is small in this strip mall. but the flavors are huge. For lunch we wanted some Cajun flare. Immediately upon walking in you think its a little cheesy decorated place, but then we seated ourselves and was soon greeted by Lynn who says she was going on her 9th year there. she was so joyous and helpful with lots of information. She made our daughter feel great buy teaching her how to make a star in the bead necklace, (Lynn---Shelby thanks you!)  After reading reviews here we decided to order the deviled eggs, although they were tasty- I think my own have bolder flavors. BUT the fried green tomatoes was outta this world!! WOOT WOOT we had the fried chicken which was recommended by Lynn and it was really good, I could taste that they are either soaked in Texas Pete or it is at least part of the breading process. but detected no "heat" per say. The chicken was crispy outside and very juicy inside. The mac n cheese is nice as well as the cucumber salad.  Great place to get some fried foods that are made to order and in house!!! no pre processed crap here!

WxV2Jzx7k0sBVID2dRaU3A.text: Loved this place. Will definitely be back when in the Charlotte area. Fried oyster appetizer was fresh and lightly breaded. I had the wahoo (catch of the day) sandwich and it was very good. My husband had the fried chicken which was awesome and a lot of food (it does take extra time to prepare so it's fresh). grN2YG0DiuaB0wcrPLU4uw.text: We eat here about once a month.  The food is good quality and spiced just right. The staff is very welcoming and friendly, the owner is always there and very friendly.   Great specials, seafood, meatloaf, mac & cheese, cheese grits,  and veggies, the desserts are the best!!!   Never had a bad meal here.

EOakS2tg9H-pUVVVOot64g.text: Easily my family's favorite restaurant to go to in Charlotte. Family's been weekly regulars for the better part of the last decade. I always try to hit the Dog when I'm town.  Everything I've ordered on the menu has been fantastic.

CUY3ibVghsnxZHwY3G2RXA.text: This place is well over priced for the service, food and atmosphere. Strike one is that in our visit for our first time was with a large party, and we were initally informed it would possibly be anywhere from an hour or 2 to be seated. The hostess was not willing to truly work at first with us, and made us feel that we were inconviencing her. We nearly left, but we were given the option to be seated in another fashion and we gave it a try. Honestly, the service was poor. Our server didn't smile an inkling, and it felt as though we were somehow an imposition on her. Our food was delivered in a timely manner, but to be frank...the food was average. It tasted good, but it was very laden with oil and the balsamic vinaigrette for the salad is extremely sweet. And something I ate there left me ill by the end of the evening. To top it all off, the decor is extrmely tacky and you could see dust around the restaurant. My husband and I, personally, will not recommend this place to our friends...nor will we be returning.

WnZ9t1bke_Yn8eY-xUUTag.text: Great restaurant for years. We have been hundreds of times. Lately we limited our ordering to fried chicken which remains great.  Other choices have been declining in quality to the point of being sometimes inedible.  We have sent fish back three times in a row.  Veggies watery and overcooked except the greens which have gone from sublime to tasting like cardboard.  You have to beg for the included biscuits and pay a dollar for honey.  Waits for tables are always long and even regulars are ignored when there are open tables at busy times.  Last night we planned as usual to arrive before the rush at 5:45 so we could dine in time to reach a movie.  Two tables for 4 were open when our friends arrived and they asked to be seated.  The hostess was rude and nasty saying they would have to wait until we all were there.  We were late by 5 minutes because of a call about our mother from the rest home she just moved to.  They complained and asked the manger to seat them explaining their predicament.  They got the last table for 4 and the gruff hostess knowing we were soon arriving promptly ripped the additional two chairs from the table even though there was no one waiting at that minute for these two chairs without a table.  Knowing this would not work,our friends left.  On the way out,the father of the hostess who has to our knowledge no association with the restaurant flipped off our friend and his wife and told him to, "get a life di..head".  At which point our friend appropriately dropped the f bomb toward this sicko.  When I arrived and was told of what happened by our friends wife, I asked to meet with the owner,Ron Atherton, who told us the hostess was simply following policy. He called our friends liars even though i didn't tell him what they said. I told him it was a stupid policy and that it was now our policy not to dine there again despite being regulars for years,essentially since the day it opened.  Will miss the chicken but not the rest of the crap.  There is always New South in the same center, always great with the nicest owners in the world and the fantastic Table274 in Cotswald to replace this tired old dive with a rude owner.

bhdQeewRL-ik4eSfEVDA-Q.text: Great food, great service! It's a very popular place with not a ton of seating, so expect a wait. I give their bread pudding my highest recommendation. Overall, the food is absolutely delish, but also pricey...

XWi7t5Gx-UjeBkG9UKDHEQ.text: This cozy lil spot serves up the best New Orleans, Deep South cuisine. My favs are the catfish nuggets- so fresh, crispy and well seasoned, and the smothered cabbage. Yum yum yum . It's not for the fitness faint of heart but super flavorful and satisfying. You can always burn off your calories by walking around the Arboretum!  Staff are friendly and seem to know the regulars. Bar selection good too! Very affordable and healthy portions... Depending on how you look at it lol
