FNx2ejVkvlG5z2BSD0yIWw.text: Deb was awesome and such a great atmosphere to be at. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a New Orleans experience

7HQGydneUag6qDsOk1p9IA.text: My wife & I have had dinner and drinks here a couple of times and have loved the food. The menu has a nice selection and everything has been great so far.

RZQZiGOt_RXMqrG60uUw9A.text: A hidden gem in the Arboretum. Go here regularly for the fresh fish. Lots of sides to choose from- everything is always excellent. Try  and get there early- they fill up fast and the wait can take awhile.

rTCk2ImQKGfvmj6VqdWKIA.text: Best. Cajun. In. Charlotte. Okay. So, they got the flavor down and it is delicious.  I literally can't keep from returning to this place. My fav is the shrimp and grits(shrimp and andouille pasta is another gd choice), and desert is fabulous as well. Dinner is a bit pricey, but lunch is more than making up for it

qe5OZW9CH3bl8L4cBgIV_Q.text: I love this place!! The fried chicken is amazing. The macaroni and cheese is fantastic! Shrimp and grits are great.   So far I haven't had anything I didn't like!   Here's a tip: try the dog sauce!!!!  The staff is very friendly. This place has a very comfortable feeling. New Orleans style restaurant. If you haven't been you need to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tabasco strips, mac and cheese and fries okra

qlr7KuTpoe1qO-cI2zceOw.text: Cajun Yard Dog is a hidden gem, tucked away into a giant strip mall.  My sister insisted on taking me and my family here for lunch (dinner gets crowded and we don't like to wait).  They have a pretty nice beer list that includes Abita, naturally.  I had the shrimp and grits with a side of fried okra.  I make shrimp and grits at home and I'm a pretty good cook, but this was much better than the one I make!  The grits were very creamy and cheesy, and the shrimp were flavorful!  The fried okra was fantastic; the coating was light and not greasy at all.  My sister always gets the chicken and waffles if they have them on special and she said it was fantastic!  My dad had the fried oysters and red beans and rice and his plate was clean at the end of the meal.   Service was fantastic, Jennifer did a great job of treating us like family and checking up on us as we enjoyed our meal.  If you love cajun/creole food or just want to try it, Cajun Yard Dog is your place!

6Y2OJk6v1sy1WPUhj44tyA.text: I often venture into Arboretum for a range of miscellaneous reasons and one day, I noticed Cajun Yard Dog. What does Cajun Yard Dog even mean? Does it matter? No, not really, but it definitely caught my eye. To me the name said simple, very casual and authentic. I bookmarked it immediately vowed to come back and see how it upholds to my beloved, Cajun Queen.  My cousin was visiting from California and we were yelping through Charlotte trying to figure out where to eat for dinner. I mentioned that I've been meaning to try Cajun Yard Dog just because the name is just so random and cool. That was enough reason for him and let me tell you, BEST life decision ever. We ordered fried oysters, deviled eggs, gumbo, fried green tomatoes, fried chicken, fried fish and much much more. The madness does not stop for fat kids. How do you judge how amazing a place is on the amazingness scale? It is how guilty you feel after every bite yet you still finish every single thing you ordered!  I've been back maybe 10 times since that first visit and Cajun Yard Dog never fails me. If I HAD to recommend a few dishes to you, it would have to be the Crawfish Etoufee, Shrimp & Grits and the Blackened Whatever the Fish of the Day is. I've had the fish of the day three times and every single time, it was AMAZING. Squeeze the slightest bit of lemon on there and viola! PERFECTION. The Crawfish Etoufee is steaming of flavor in every bite and they are mighty generous with the amount of crawfish you get (and for $10!). If you don't get the shrimp & grits, you HAVE to get the cheese grits as a side along with the Green Bean Almondine. No idea what kind of wizardry goes on in the kitchen, but I am beyond addicted to Cajun Yard Dog! The food is amazing. The staff has that southern hospitality that makes you feel just at home and the prices are RIDICULOUS.. ridiculously CHEAP! See this is where I'm conflicted. As much as I love Cajun Queen, the prices are steep! Cajun Yard Dog gives me the authenticity, the quality and the bang for my buck. Let's just say I've cheated on my beloved CQ quite a bit nowadays.  Side note: I recommend going for lunch instead of dinner. The portion sizes between lunch and dinner aren't significantly different, but the prices definitely are! Lunch prices are about $10 or less and dinner prices are close to $20. I have to admit that even though I know this, I still came back for dinner once because I couldn't get the yard dog cravings out of my system and the next day was Sunday (the only day that they're closed)! Not my fault, I was trapped.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits!!

JlFc6IaeVRfSo-XecbeO9g.text: Wow it was really great, the oyster app was only $10 and had at least 12 oysters, perfect to share.  Blackened salmon was amazing, loved the grits and stir fried veggies, and husband got etoufee and it was filled with crawfish.  So thrilled that for once we were able to have a relaxing meal in a restaurant where we weren't rushed.  She took our order after our appetizer arrived, which was great.  Perfect service-you could definitely see the owner's influence and attention.  Which is rare these days.

-GGTw_XocFwRHc84mwiaNQ.text: This place is OUTSTANDING, and Al the owner always takes the time to say hi. My favorite is the 'Shrimp and Andouille Sausage' I add crawfish to it, its off the hook! It's tough not getting the fried catfish or chicken. The only thing wrong with this place is I want to eat it everything on the menu!

SeG5AmAQ4vp_gKz94bVZWg.text: Many of our dishes were tasty but I wish there was more heat and spice.  However I love that there's cajun cuisine nearby so I'll come back.

ymqnEOhDDPfg7HVbyN9aWQ.text: First time here. Chose this because of yelp reviews.  The cajun Chicken breast was the best!  And the smothered cabbage was to die for! Greens were way to  salty for my liking. Fried green tomatoes were yummy!!  The jalapeno tarter sauce was not working.... but great customer service and i will definitely be back!

yyQvB6DFIZcf0DyVPQoUww.text: We have been in Charlotte just over 2 years and love to try new restaurants every time we go out but we love CYD and go frequently enough that we have become recognized regulars by Keith, the best server ever!  Between the food and Keith's fun serving style, it's easily our favorite spot in the area!  Whenever we have visitors, CYD is always on the list of things to show them, and have yet to have anyone not love it!  The shrimp and grits, jambalaya and mac and cheese are amazing! The owner always makes the rounds checking on each table which is a nice personal touch.  The decor is fun Mardi Gras style.  It's not a fancy spot but if you're looking for good food, fun servers and fun atmosphere, you absolutely can't go wrong here!

J1NpODkgs-z32e6gqBQ41g.text: If it would let me give a 3.5, I would. CYD is a story of almosts, yes, plural. My friend and I were trying to escape the downpour. We saw this place across the parking lot and decided to make a run for it. I'll try to keep it short.   The menu got me stupid excited. It was like I was three years old and stumbled into a candy shop, only full of Cajun food. Every dish sounded great. It was a list full of classics. We got there after three, so we missed the chicken and waffles! Dammit!   I decided on the Catfish po'boy so I could eat half and save room for the chocolate pecan pie later. My friend ordered the blackened meatloaf with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  My po'boy was okay. I've had better, but it wasn't bad. My friend's meatloaf and sides were very good. Though, there was nothing blackened about that meatloaf. A bit of a misnomer, but awesome nonetheless.   Dessert fell flat. My chocolate pecan pie tasted more like a melted hot fudge sundae. I wish the chocolate had more body to it, like a custard. My friend's bread pudding was also just okay.   I plan on returning, but next time I'll try an entree instead of a po'boy. OH, no liquor here. They only serve beer, wine, and nonalcoholic drinks. It's too bad. I wanted a hurricane. The whole experience had a lot of potential. It was almost great.

HxBIpwMzgRac24B9H1P-FQ.text: Delicious food all the way around, I got the Tabasco po boy and my daughter got the meatloaf po boy. Both were really tastey and I even had half of hers for lunch the next day. I was originally drawn here for their bananas foster dessert, it seems like the only place around that serves it and they definitely delivered. We will definitely be returning!

u1DqWD5Z3X4XYHc1MtSaPQ.text: I've been working in the area for 3 years and never heard of this place. Why not? Its awesome!! I went for lunch with my 3 coworkers. We all ordered different entrees. I also ordered the Calamari since I HAVE to order it anytime I see it on a menu. For the most part I enjoyed it, though I wish it had been fried a bit crispier. It had Fried Okra and Artichokes in it which was a nice touch. I ordered the Chicken Cordon Blue. It was sooooooooo good! Soooooooo much flavor. It excited me as soon as that first bite hit my tongue. I also tried a bite of all of my coworkers food and everything has so much flavor. I was very pleased and excited to come back and try other dishes at this restaurant now knowing that nothing we ordered was bad. We also ordered the Banana Bread Pudding....... just no words... other than delicious!! I had only a couple bites because it is so rich. We all shared on and had some left over, even with me only having a couple bites. I will definitely be making this place a lunch regular!

80c9mdtfzRBZk17UQnhn9w.text: This place is absolutely delicious. I've been many times and have never had a bad experience. The staff is her fun and friendly and the food is absolutely delicious. Make sure to ask for it spicy if you want a little kick!

9dCJ1fFyv0I-xlrxOd0Cag.text: Best Po Boy in Charlotte, excellent catfish and sides also.  Awesome food, this is a hidden diamond  A punch and lots of flavor

jZ1BxG0YREndBa1-LgfNUQ.text: Great chix and waffles.  Fried shrimp was spot on. Service was efficient. Sides were super.

eB8Yff7R6y5KUK89LSosVw.text: I got the Catfish platter with Mac & Cheese and Potato Salad. It was some of the best catfish I've ever had, and I am pretty picky about catfish and Lowcountry food in general. The batter was awesome and so was the tartar sauce. The Mac & cheese was smooth, creamy, and cheesy. The potato salad has a kick to it. Our waitress was the sweet and knowledgeable Miss Emerald. Her expertise with the menu helped us pick the perfect meals. She knew how to engage in just the right amount of conversation to make us feel welcome and appreciated. Overall great experience. I'll be back, for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish platter, Mac n cheese, and potato salad

JvB54MLSaqPmKp33_FWgtw.text: We truly enjoyed the food. We had oyster Po boy, Salmon, mahi mahi, etouffee and all of the meals were good. The dessert was kind of fun too beccause they had an eggnog pound cake. It's a casual restaurant with really good food and lots of options.

2vnSfgXjkjiiQpYd6ysu8A.text: We actually traveled like 45 min to eat here.. I'll give it a 2 only bc our fish was hot... nothing to write home about. Overpriced and the sides were baby size. The fry was good on the catfish. Won't be going back.. service wasn't the best either

pPseEY7bMHHF-XPKMHCzzQ.text: Brought my family here last week after finally choosing this place for my birthday night. Wow it impressed us. My dad loved his fried catfish strips, my mom ordered some fried oysters that were also delicious. The chicken my sister ordered came out fried to perfection. My girlfriend cleaned her plate of Blackened salmon and collared greens so I'm sure that was pretty good too! My meal, the seafood jambalaya, was just awesome. A big helping of crawfish, shrimp, chicken sausage, and mussels mixed together in Cajun rice was enough to fill any man up. The mac and cheese I chose as a side was good and deffinitely made from scratch. At the end of the meal the kind hostess offered us a free dessert to try and I chose the banana foster. It was tasty but a little runny. Not gunna complain though much, it was free! We all really enjoyed our meals and deffinitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Jambalaya! Awesomeness!

XqTXMzz278PYaqgHnoyFrw.text: Always enjoy my visits to the Cajun yard dog in the Arboretum. Fresh seafood and the Chicken Cordon Bleu are my favorite items on the menu. Many good side items as well. Here's a tip, go for lunch; nearly half the price on some items, just smaller portions

zKYlYfRK5aS-AakyqK5rnw.text: UNBELIEVABLE FOOD. The service is also wonderful, the server always remembers my order and gets it exactly right every time!

cDbreQYgwnsWAcf5cmnayw.text: Mm mac and cheese is so delish and creamy. Their jambalaya is great and the service is 8/10.

Q7CbbBaaUcZeA71AFrweCg.text: Everything is made from scratch from the appetizers to the desserts and everything is to die for. The fried oysters were fantastic even for those who don't usually like oysters. Everything fried was delicious, the crust is just perfect. The grilled fish was also very flavorful and fresh.   Beyond the food, our server was incredibly nice and helpful. You can tell that everyone who works there loves it too and wants you to enjoy your meal as much as possible. The line is always out the door at peak times and for obvious reasons. If you are trying to avoid the line, coming early is always a good idea.

kaY3KYiIINlxrkXCpgeRdw.text: Love this place. Service is always great.  Food is outstanding. Special are always a wonderful surprise. Some portions big enough to share so apps, dinner and desert are doable as shared.

R16zQpyyxYxJ1XSoNbd8yQ.text: Wanted to visit this place for a long time. Had the crawfish etoufee with a side of mac n cheese. It was awesome!  Sat at the bar and the lady who waited on me was incredibly attentive and charming. They pride themselves on their selection of hot sauces, but the best on offer is the the one that they make. If you like a little extra spice, ask for the "dog sauce".  It's incredible!  Nice people, fast service, great food and friendly employees. It is a great strip mall find.

s-9WyPGRV73-szrowLE2jQ.text: Crap I'm so full I can hardly write this review. My stomach is way beyond my pants. I really tried to stop but the bread pudding came out and it was a beacon of  deliciousness and shamefully I did inhale. Prices are 10-20 per plate. Bread pudding was just under 6$ not including 1.50 for ice cream. Fried shrimp not over cooked amazing. My son said the Mac and cheese was the best. Service was good. It's smaller inside then I thought. Def worth a try. I really wanted more crawdad on the menu but oh well it was still good and we will be back

bx2ZaL4xM4JI1VzOiulWlg.text: This used to be one of our favorite restaurants,  but it has taken a downhill turn the last few times we have been here.   Tonight,  the chicken cordon bleu arrived with no cheese.   The maux choux sauce had no corn,  no peppers, or anything in it.   Just a dull cream sauce. I don't know if there are new owners,  etc., but definitely no where near the quality and taste. I'm sad.

bl3vFQRD1NjL7fDDQz13EA.text: Possibly the worst service that I've ever had. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants years ago, but what I understand is New Management,and it has gone to the dogs. The last three times I was there I actually got up and left in the middle of my meal. I kept going back because I hoped so much that it was just single bad experience and it would improve. It has not. There are many great restaurants in Charlotte, there is no reason to risk another major disappointment and such absolutely terrible service

Remv2bKajLGzljzAntmrSQ.text: I went by the CYD to grab some gumbo to go. Wouldn't you know it, I locked my keys and wallet in my car! While waiting for the locksmith, the owner graciously gave me my gumbo and asked if he could offer me anything else. Totally amazing service, food and a very hands on owner! and if you need a locksmith, call Neil Williams 704-307-8536 at Consolidated Locksmiths. He opened my Mercedes after other professionals said it could not be done without the car "locking up".

UbXKOtD7kAKtVuBiue1Atw.text: The MOST amazing find!! Who knew New Orleans was hiding in the Arboretum!! This place is great! The owner Allen has done an amazing job with keeping the food 100% creole and creating a genuinely southern ambiance!! The Etouffe is rich and flavorful, and a good portion. The Collards made my lips smack...if your a soul food officianado you know that means good!!! The potato salad and Mac&cheese were excellent! I've found my new Favorite Place!!

fiKJRqS-EwQSULcDb2Bgrw.text: This is my favorite place to go to satisfy my taste buds. The food is absolutely delicious! And the owner ensures that the service is top notch! I can't recommend just one thing because everything is good!

C9yvqe4FPQPfjXvskE7XFg.text: I had the gumbo and the blackened mahi. The gumbo was delicious. It was spicy and had a lot of stuff in it. I would've gotten a bigger bowl if I had known it was that good. The Mahi was huge! I couldn't believe it was only $15. It was a really good value and included two sides. I got the smash potatoes which was good and the rice which was meh and a bit on the salty side.  I found this place on Yelp and it definitely did not disappoint. I don't think I'll be back in Charlotte anytime soon but this place would definitely be worth coming back.

nBC-674n87emv8yrLgG0_g.text: Fantastic food.  Would definitely come back here next time I am in Matthews.  My grandmother loved it.

fv5v9KUs5bdvD1gjdQfFQg.text: Smothered cabbage was delicious. Very friendly staff and comfort feel inside. The jalapeno deviled eggs and fried oysters or calamari or anything else are mandatory

2WfhjuQK8UcItcYYkygahQ.text: It is not your average-Charlotte menu. Most of the food is fried and it is certainly flavorful, but I wouldn't say spicy or hot.   It is a decent casual place to grab lunch and I would certainly go back.

LwEFTZ_25eN3MDD11NmX-Q.text: The prices are a bit high but the food is great. The blackened meatloaf is excellent.

N0z2uNetrQU5J5yhgDvTZA.text: I grew up in Southern Louisiana so I have had a few authentic Cajun meals in my day.  By far, CYD has the best Gumbo in the City and I have tried most places that offer Gumbo.  When I say best, it's the closest to the dark roux southern Louisiana gumbo I remember.  The red beans and rice are good and the etouffee is excellent.  Prices are moderate.  From reading some of the reviews, it seems prices are being compared with McDonalds.  No they don't have a dollar menu.  Try Burger King.

sHi6Yjmdp-YU-lrsqGsXKg.text: The hubby and I were searching for a new restaurant to try out for a quick lunch and we ended up at Cajun Yard Dog.  The place is a little small but quaint.  The ambiance was relaxed and casual with a seat yourself approach at the front door.  The menu offered plenty of tasty cajun options including the standard jumbalaya and po' boy sandwiches.  I enjoyed the fact that they had a long list of classic southern sides to choose from on the menu (however corn bread, one of my favorites at cajun restaurants, is not included in this list).  I ordered the pimento grilled cheese sandwich with a side of collard greens.  My meal was delicious.  The pimento cheese had quite a kick to it and my nose was running by the end of the meal.  My husband ordered the seafood jumbalaya.  He's long been in search for the best jumbalaya in Charlotte and has ordered it at several restaurants only to be disappointed.  He actually seemed to enjoy it at this restaurant even though it was served with mussels which is usually outside of his seafood range.   The service was decent despite the fact that only one waitress was serving the entire restaurant by herself.  I liked that I was able to get a to-go cup for my tea when we were leaving.  It made up for the fact that they didn't offer splenda in their repertoire of sweeteners on the table.

IDMjPf6sbBNE4sDMzSClcg.text: Celebrated New Years with some close friends and wanted to brag about what a great experience we had. Our Server Lynn, was very friendly and knowledgeable. She made great recommendations. We all had different plates from fried chicken, Blacken Mahi Mahi and the Spicy Cajun Jambalaya. Great Food, Great Service and nicely priced.

JrvfNBVgoSNSa3XXJwXr8Q.text: When first going to the Cajun Yard dog, I thought that it was fantastic. I continued to go and notice that there was an inconsistency with the food; one day its good the next  day not so much. I notice especially with the side dishes, the collard greens are ALWAYS overcooked, the macaroni and cheese is always a different consistency.  When they fry things it's never cooked all the way though there are always uncooked parts of the batter that they use and on top of that they are moderately expensive for inconsistent food. I have decided its best that we part ways. Oh and the management is rude and never speaks to anyone. I will NOT be going back!

MQ_HC7Xts7ol9QOKdnX1gg.text: Yes, they are slow, but the food is cooked to order in a small kitchen!  It's worth the wait......so think about chillin while you wait. If they tried to rush you out to boost their volume, you would be mad about that!

C4hFjzEuRfDnLZAAKgQQ8Q.text: Creole cooking - the largest mystique of my culinary curiosity. Sure, I've eaten a lot of weird shit; it's a trait that comes with shoving an item in your mouth as your first method of solving general curiosity. But Cajun food... how does it work? What the hell is in it that is supposed to make it so good? My general impression of Cajun food is that people, living in a swamp their whole lives, lived off dredging the bottom of river beds and boiling or frying whatever came up. Usually when people are faced with the most unusual ingredients, then they'll work their hardest to make it taste good, and there came the allure. Creole became my culinary unicorn.  Living in New England, I didn't stand a chance at finding any creole. I read up on it a lot, but also couldn't find a lot of the ingredients, like a gumbo file or crawfish.  When I moved to Charlotte, I had my first Cajun experience at the Cajun Queen. I split a seafood etouffee. While not holding the spice I was hoping for, it was pretty good all the same.   Thusly.... we come to the Cajun Yard Dog. It was an interesting night to go. I had loaded up on margaritas and wasn't feeling all that hungry for the fried oyster po'boy I had been eyeing on the interweb for months, so instead went for the gumbo.   I got the wrong damn gumbo. I wanted seafood gumbo, because chicken, sausage and rice doesn't interest me, and it was in a beef broth, not seafood stock, so it wasn't particularly to my liking. For what it was, though, it was pretty good. I was expecting something much thicker, however. There was a spicy tang at the end, but not much of a flavorful palate to begin with.  We did start off with the fried artichoke/okra/calamari app, and that was pretty good, but standard fare. Their 'remoulade,' as a lot of people have pointed out, really tastes like mayonnaise and cocktail sauce slightly stirred together. Not impressed.   One person I was with got the crawfish etouffee, but it wasn't as flavorful as the one at the Cajun Queen, not to mention that there was too much rice and it overwhelmed the sauce. Also, the collards were undercooked.   The last item that didn't disappoint, was that my friend got a blackened chicken po'boy. This was a frickin' huge sandwich, and the chicken was cooked well, was spicy, and had huge slices of tomato with lots of lettuce on flavorful bread. The one thing that I really wanted turned out to be the only really good thing at the table.   Bottom line:   The atmosphere was friendly, and the service was good. For food, stick with the po'boys. I am definitely going back because I need a fried oyster po'boy! Everything else that I experienced... I'd want to go elsewhere.

PSeHrfS_WrO0bOHGPHBxFA.text: This is one of the few Charlotte restaurants my husband and I visit on a regular basis and is one of the few restaurants we take visitors to Charlotte to.  Although small inside, the atmosphere is jumping with everything "southern" and "Louisiana" on the walls.  The waitstaff is very friendly and have great recommendations for first timers. The jalapeno deviled eggs are an excellent starter. For lunch I always get the Catfish Po Boy with sweet potato fries.  For dinner the red beans and rice entree is my favorite.  Be sure to save room for Chocolate Pecan Pie or take it to go. Good beer and wine selection too.

JiJFzyImOc1YlA9mgKckFw.text: This place is as close to True Cajun Cooking as I have experienced since I left Louisiana!  I had the Chicken Jambalaya with Mac n Cheese on my first visit and it left me with definate desire to return.  The Jambalaya is exactly the way I had it Down in LA.  Who DAT?  The Cajun Yard Dog is Dat!  The texture and the Flavors were right on mark.  It was an explosion of different flavors going off on my taste buds!  Not just a meal, an eating experience!  After all isn't that what we all want when we go out to eat.  Well you will find it here.  The Mac n Cheese is to die for.  It is very similar to my wifes Mac n Cheese and I absolutely love her Mac n Cheese.  Creamy, Rich and the pasta cooked just right, tender buit not soft and mushy.  Delicious! My wife had the Fried Catfish with Jalapeno tartar, fried Okra and Red Beans and rice!  I sampled each of her items and this is my opinion of them.  The Catfish was nothing short of amazing!  Very Crispy on the outside and light and fluffy inside with a hint of spice(heat) in the batter. Mouthwatering by itself but the Jalapeno Tartar made it pop!  The fried okra was just like Mama made it!  Delicious!  The Red Beans and Rice were so good It'd make you want to slap your Mama!  A perfect blend of seasonings and spice to drive your taste buds wild!  The best Red Beans and Rice I have ever had and I have had plenty. I asked the waitress how the Gumbo was and she quickly brought me a sample.  It was just like I had expected.  Right on the money!  All thier dishes are made fresh daily and have the flavor and feel of a homecooked meal.  The atmosphere is upbeat and vibrant with that small romantic New Orleans Cafe feeling!  Awesome for a lunch date or any occasion.  To sum things up, I had an outstanding meal with a decent price in a comfortable environment.  What else could you want.  My family and I will definately be back!  WHO DAT?  WE DAT!

6SzbVcXIJYeg0xdbva-o1Q.text: Love this restaurant!  We've been coming here for years and have always had a wonderful experience.  I've read some of the other negative reviews and I couldn't disagree more!!!  We are regulars too, but we do not expect special treatment.  Isn't a wait a good sign of a great restaurant with excellent food and terrific service??    I cannot speak more highly of the food.  I absolutely LOVE their cajun dishes and always end the meal with a dessert (the chocolate/pecan pie is my favorite!).    I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great meal in an awesome atmosphere.

OK6xklup-1eDKn7hzUp6ew.text: This place is enjoyable, but it's not the best cajun food I've ever had. I've been twice and had the shrimp and grits and the catfish po' boy. Both were decent. That's about all I can say about it.

suFnkZ3clVb1aqdWkfpAog.text: This place's menu held much promise for me, but was quite a disappointment.  I've only been there once, but there was a common characteristic running through all their food that was hard to ignore...no seasoning!  I love Cajun food, primarily because I enjoy the type of food and the spices.  At CYD, you can find all your favorites on the menu; just don't look for them to be properly seasoned.  Jalepeno Deviled Eggs:  there was an essence of jalapeno but absolutely no kick...and no salt.  Just a bland deviled egg.  Fried Oysters:  A little too greasy and absolutely no seasoning in the batter.  I'll go so far to say that they were the most bland fried oysters I've ever been served.  My sides were "all day green beans" (bland), collards (bland), and slaw (bland).  The quality of food was pretty good.  Just don't look for authentic cajun flavor here.  Maybe I hit them on a bad day, but you'd think that I would've liked something here...but not so much.  Seriously...salt, cayenne, and peppers are pretty cheap.  CYD ought to invest five bucks and give these a try.

MEsAH9aFSqUEeFV6RPdNUg.text: Thumbs way up: a variety of Abita to choose from, including root beer for the kiddies. Thumbs kinda downish: gumbo that smells and tastes like pepper gravy and BBQ shrimp that don't seem BBQ'd at all. More like stirred up in some tomatoes in a pan. Thumbs really really down: zydeco mardi gras hell atmosphere I know you are never gonna get real Cajun, Louisiana cooking in the Carolinas or elsewhere, but why? Why is it that even people FROM Louisiana can't open a place in another city and have it be authentic? It's like there is an Authenticity Force Field around south Louisiana.  I am giving this place 3 stars because of the Abita and the fabulous appetizer called the Calamari Okrachokie (fried okra, calamari and artichokes with a sort of Cane's sauce, if you know what I mean) and the perfectly breaded and fried catfish filet. It's harder than you think to fry stuff in a truly appetizing way. And the very friendly and accommodating staff gets my appreciation as well.

upoKqvtSFrgUvbaY1qauBg.text: It is what it is I guess. I rolled with it all till the end but If you don't mind being rushed to order by a no patience, rather be somewhere else waitress(which you  have empathy with at first)  who brings you food and forks but no napkins and then seater who points out the  $18.00 dish he brought you is missing its side and he will bring it later but never does, and no ever comes and checks on you (so you never have a chance to remind anyone) and then this hurry up waitress leaves you waiting ten minutes for the to go box never asking how the meal was, then you catch the seater walking by  as we were putting the food in the to go box and let him know that he forgot our side,  his response was a glib  non apologetic do want some to go, I said hell no, now its about me saying "hell no" vs the bad service we received, i quickly apologized to the guy so I wouldn't have to smack him. then waited another 15 minutes for my credit card back. Food was ok, some sides were cold, don't know if they were meant to be(rice and beans-maybe?) So go there if you don't mind there expectation of you being an efficient customer(because they are busy), than receive inefficient service with cold overpriced missing food.

fxf3Mx3pGpEG2-kjV8rTUA.text: Family vacation to visit friends who now live in NC. We are all originally from NOLA and wanted to give this place a try. We were in the mood for home cooking. I have to say they were not bad. The fried chicken was good and they do something really special with their cabbage that I have never seen but made it really good. My girls 7 and 9yrs had the mac n cheese and loved it. The red beans were luck warm when they came to our table and tasted can. The seafood was OK but could use a little more seasoning (you know how we like our seasoning). The service was also good the waitress was very nice.

HHLR08j2Je5rQiZwieCt9A.text: Sorry, this place doesn't get it. I went two years ago and it was ok but this week it was C- at best. The catfish was greasy and the oysters were soggy. Must have changed hands recently.

8gR77W1Vzs9j7tQwXnmDfw.text: Great little restaurant.  One of the best places in Charlotte.  Been numerous times and never had a bad anything.  Staff is great.  One of the only places I take visitors to Charlotte to eat.
